JobListing.ShortDescription: Great Opportunity for PHP Developer to join growing business with a variety of Technology Projects
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Freelance and / or onsite role
  • Laravel / WordPress / Back End / Front End
  • Opportunity for remote work and / or work from home

Stellar Technology is pleased to offer an exceptional opportunity to work with internal technology projects. Our business is a dynamic, diverse and people orientated company with a high performance culture. We currently have multiple (part time and full time) opportunities coming available as our business grows.

Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer these newly created hybrid roles will incorporate Full Stack Development including Front and Back End development, database and migrations, along with server management tasks.

To be considered for the role we would be looking for the following:

  • Computer Science or Information Technology Degree (GPA 5+)
  • PHP / Laravel 5.1 / 5.2 Experience
  • WordPress Front End and Back End Development
  • Photoshop and illustrator skillset
  • Highly experienced in: jQuery, AngularJS, CSS3, HTML5, MySQL,
  • Experience in unit testing (PHPUNIT) and Ionic Framework (Phonegap) advantageous
  • Familiarity with virtual box and vagrant
  • Communication with Skype / Slack and email will be required

We are open to considering candidates who wish to have flexible working arrangements e.g. hours of work and / or work from home. Please note candidates can be expected to be tested on their technical abilities / knowledge.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below or send me an email directly quoting reference number LE28497, SK0549Z

Alternatively feel free to give me a call on 0730099621 or email me directly.

JobListing.ShortDescription: 5-10years’ experience required | Long-term Opportunity| Well-established successful contractor
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Earthworks, Roading, Drainage and subdivisions
  • Long-term role, lots of projects in the pipeline
  • Salary negotiable depending on experience (guideline of $110,000 – 140,000 + vehicle)

Our client is looking for an experienced Project Manager to join their team working on larger civil projects with a focus on roading and land development. If you have solid experience working as a Project Engineer/Manager on a range of civil construction projects we’d like to hear from you. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a reputable company with a long history in the Auckland market. The project is expected to be kicking off around June / July.

Key duties will include:

  • Managing both operational, financial and contractual aspects of the project
  • Organising all the required materials
  • Maintain health and safety standards across all sites
  • Manage subcontractors
  • Client Liaison
  • QA, Site Engineering.
  • Monitoring claims, variations, programming and planning
  • Ensure projects are completed on time and to budget

Key requirements for this position include:

  • A minimum of 5-10years’ project engineering or management experience in civil construction
  • Tertiary qualification, ideally BA in Civil Engineering
  • Sound working knowledge of NZ HSE requirements
  • Excellent communication skills with ability to get along well with staff at all levels within the organisation

Candidates must have the right to live and work in New Zealand

To apply for this position please click  APPLY or email your CV direct quoting reference number MD28588

JobListing.ShortDescription: Amazing opportunity for the commercially minded person to excel in a rapidly growing business
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Senior Quantity Surveyor / Contracts Administrator

Join a well-established successful commercial contractor that is backed by a comprehensive portfolio of works, has a friendly knowledgeable team of professionals, offering a stable long-term position.
This local well established and very respected commercial contractor who is a recognised leader in quality commercial construction, with expertise in new-build construction, interior fit out and refurbishment works and have a number of new opportunities.
Offer their clients a full range of building solutions, from fast track build projects, estimation and feasibility studies, through to full service, end-to-end delivery of commercial projects. With a strong partnership driven approach and a client focussed business model, this contractor has strong relationships with high profile clients and receives a sturdy amount of repeat business.
A rare opportunity has arisen for a Senior Quantity Surveyor, who brings local market knowledge and experience in commercial construction, to contribute to the on- success of this team. You will be joining an experienced business working from tender to final account on your own projects.

In this position your responsibilities will include:
• Providing accurate cost options for proposed contracts
• Estimation through to managing actual cost against budget through the duration of each project
• Perform detailed take offs
• Costing variations
• Authorising of payments to subcontractor and trade creditors and monitoring of retentions held
• Building and maintaining close client relationships and understanding of their requirements
• Work closely with site management, attending site meetings
• Working to a high level of autonomy

Successful candidates will have:
• A relevant tertiary qualification
• Technical skill and commercial build experience suitable to the role with good practical working knowledge
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and good in a team environment
• Experience with an estimating software package.
• Must have local New Zealand based experience

You will be in a position to significantly contribute to the company’s and your own success, and be able to put your name on successful builds around Christchurch.

If you feel you have the skills, attributes and drive to make a significant contribution to one of Christchurch’s leading commercial construction contractors we would like to hear from you today.

Please contact Matt if you have any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this position. Otherwise you can express your interest by applying today. Your application will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

Consultant: Matt McIntyre
Phone: 03 9282 464
Email: matt.m@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Top Brands | Strong Leadership Internally | Untapped Opportunities | Ag Sector
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Top of the line equipment and strong international brands.
• Small but modern teams with huge growth potential in the near future
• Progressive company with a family culture all about their people.
• Pivotal role within the Canterbury Agricultural sector.

Due to strong continued growth, a promising opportunity has arisen for a Service/ Operations Manager to work for a top agricultural company, operating throughout the region. In this position you will play a pivotal role in the leading and managing a solid branch in the agricultural sector and the teams within to grow and support a solid, but ever morphing, agricultural equipment market in the thriving Canterbury sector. Overseeing a strong team of dedicated technicians in the workshop and the field, playing a part in the on-going maintenance repair and on-going growth of the well-known brands they support, you will back this with a solid understanding of what makes a strong team tick, leading the charge with your own ability to set and achieve budgets and re work to a minimum and with an ability to understand and adjust P&L’s. You will be familiar with driving and promoting the progression of individuals within the team, including training of apprentices, accreditation of existing staff and growing existing business within the market as well as seeing opportunities yet to be tapped into. Working with a brands that utilises some of the best technology available in the market, industry safety standards that are second to none and a wealth of knowledge in their teams, you will have the opportunity to continue to develop your managerial skills and experience in the sector, and will be rewarded with progression opportunities and a strong salary with performance based incentives.

You’ll need to have the following:
• Ideally Trade Certification (equipment or engineering) within the agricultural sector within the New Zealand or Australian market.
• At least 5 years’ experience in a leadership capacity as a workshop manager or service management type role.
• Strong Farming practice experience would be highly advantageous.
• Excellent interpersonal skills and a passion for providing a quality service to both staff and clients alike.
• Strong leadership style and an open door policy.
• Ability to relocate and be residentially based throughout Canterbury.
As an employer this company has a strong market profile, family values and stability, providing excellent longer term growth potential and with upcoming growth and expansion inevitable, there has never been a better time to make your mark in the industry.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the brands you’ll be working on, or for info on other opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our maintenance team today.

Emily Keene, Division Manager
+643 353 5684
emily@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Join a Leading NZ Commercial Builder / Deliver an Iconic $120M Building in Christchurch / CIRCA $120-135K (Relocations/Flights neg.) / IMMED START!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Relocate to New Zealand via Stellar
  • Busy Building Industry, Multiple REAL Jobs
  • CIRCA $120-135K, Immediately Start Available!

Stellar Recruitment has offices in Christchurch and Auckland in addition to Perth, and we are currently working to place an experienced commercial building Senior Site Manager with a leading building company in Christchurch, New Zealand.

Stellar Recruitment is well established in New Zealand with existing relationships with many of the busiest building companies involved in the Christchurch rebuild program, and throughout New Zealand on other significant building projects. We are sourcing now to find a Senior Site Manager to lead the construction of an iconic $120m landmark building in Christchurch. This company has a terrific brand in the NZ building sector and a bulging order book of key projects to deliver in the next 5-10 years.

In addition to this role, we have multiple similar roles available for Site Managers and Senior Site Managers in Auckland and other parts of NZ. Applicants require 5-20 years of Site Management experience in Australia or NZ on schools, hospitals, commercial office buildings or similar valued $20m-$200m.

To be considered for this Christchurch Senior Site Manager position or similar roles in New Zealand, you must have a stable work history and relevant experience as a Site Manager working for Tier 1 & Tier 2 building contractors successfully delivering similar types of building projects as those listed above, strong leadership qualities, and you must have a willingness and ability to relocate to NZ within the next few months. You must also have existing rights to live and work in New Zealand and a desire to remain for 3-4 years minimum.

This is a really attractive opportunity to lock in some job security for the foreseeable future and get stuck into live projects with a company that has strong workflow and multiple projects, many of which are changing the face of Christchurch.

Remuneration packages in New Zealand are improving and as Senior Site Manager you can expect CIRCA $120-135K package (relocation/flights negotiable). New Zealand is the adventure capital of the world with a fabulous lifestyle and lower cost of living, so if this sounds exciting to you, please get in touch with us today!

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number SA28662.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Work for a prestigious longstanding builder on high-end, one off, architecturally designed homes
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Established company
Large team of builders
Independent position

We are currently looking for a strong Quantity Surveyor to work for a very well respected, award winning, recognised local builder based in Queenstown. This rare position has become available due to growth. This is a full time long term position with continuing growth in the future.

This company has been in operation for 40 years and still remains as a modern cutting edge operation. You will be joining a team of office based and site based staff of 45, working on large one off high scale homes and some light commercial projects. These builders really are experts in their field.

This is an independent position so you must have at least three years’ experience running projects from tender to handover with full Quantity Surveying responsibility’s in-between.

To be considered for this positon you will ideally have:
- Recent commercial or architectural experience
- A relevant qualification
- At least 3 years Quantity Surveying experience from take-off to hand over
- Professional presentation and communication
- A down to earth team player attitude

Your position will include:
-Tendering
- Detailed estimation
- Pricing and scheduling of all quantities
- Liaison with clients, design consultants and construction contractors
- Contract administration
- Cost-management
- Variations
- Progress payments
- Final account

For a genuine career opportunity to work in one of the most beautiful places in the world, not to mention the number of activities and fine dining, in a role where you will have high responsibility, variation and challenging projects, simply apply with your CV now or call Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, to discuss further on 027 635 3330.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Work on high end one-off builds
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
- Queenstown based, full time position
- Architectural, exciting and interesting builds
- Established well regarded building company with an impressive portfolio of works

Reporting into the Managing Director you will be running the sales process from initial consultation to final hand over on new home builds for family’s and professionals, across multiple sites in the Queenstown area.

You will be working for an established building contractor that is known and well regarded in the market that carries its own professional builders. You will need to be relationship focused as you will be assisting and guiding the clients through every stage of the build and decision making process.

This company is offering strong support, reliable systems, but the freedom to do it your way with good earning potential on top your salary base. You will be working in prominent areas, with project value's from $400,000 - $1million+, typically $600,000 +.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Initial consultation with perspective buyers
- Sales contract and negotiation
- Full agreeance of build plan and specifications
- Dealing closely in-house Project Manager’s to ensure all speciation’s are workable
- All client liaison
- You will need to have an intimate understanding of the building process and products/furnishings

To be considered for this position you will:
- Have sales experience relative to the construction industry, ideally in new home builds
- Have a client lead, relationship based sales style
- Be self-motivated and proactive
- Worked in fast passed sales environments
- Worked on many projects/sales at various stages at one give time
- Be able to relocate easily, or already be based in Queenstown for this long term career position.

If working in the adventure capital of the world, on world class residential builds, for an established company with a good brand sounds like you, we look forward to viewing your application.

We are looking to fill this, and another New Homes Sales position also based in Queenstown, ASAP. If you have any questions in the meantime please do not hesitate to call Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, for a private conversation on 03 974 2442 or 027 635 3330.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Service Technicians required for Geraldton, Katanning & Esperance. Full Time - Industry leader in Agriculture Equipment - International Training!!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Do Tractors, Harvesters and Balers spin your wheels?
• Do you want a chance to progress your career as a diesel mechanic?
• Want to work for a company whose talk turns into action?
• Want the opportunity to fly internationally for your training?
• Do you want to work for a company that rewards their technicians?

A promising role has arisen for 3 Agricultural Mechanics / Field Service Mechanics to work for one of the leaders in the agricultural equipment industry based in Geraldton, Katanning and Esperance. In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance, servicing and repair of a wide range of specialised Tractors, Harvesters and Bailers, as well as a range of auxiliary agricultural equipment in the workshop and out in the field. You will work for a company that values their staff and encourages progression and career advancement (including international training) from within. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your strong background, solid technical skills and experience and will be rewarded with training opportunities, state of the art work systems, leadership training from strong management teams and a competitive pay packet. Relocation could be available for top notch candidates.

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Proven experience maintaining diesel equipment (preferably with an agricultural background) with trade certification while favourable is not essential.
• Experience working in either a workshop or onsite.
• Excellent diagnostic skills both using computer systems and visual fault finding skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• A strong ability to be a self-starter and get the job done.

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best and progress your career, or you’re looking to back your passion for agricultural equipment- either way, this position could be the ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals.

To apply or to find out more details contact Richard on 08 9422 2726 or Richard.S@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Highly reputable WA Building Company / SOR Location, Avoid Traffic, On site parking/Start on Contract, Permanent options if you excel/CIRCA $70/hr
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Superb WA Building Company
  • South of the River Location, Avoid Traffic!
  • CIRCA $70/hr, Permanent Role Available!

Our client is an established and successful West Australian civil and building construction contractor that has an IMMEDIATE need to recruit a contract Estimator to join their experienced team based in Perth’s southern suburbs. There is a strong possibility this role will go permanent in time. This business delivers construction projects typically valued up to $5m which may include; commercial and industrial buildings (public and private sector), apartments, mixed use developments and minor civil infrastructure (earthworks and concrete).

Working for this company is rewarding. You’ll join a professional team with great leadership who are vastly experienced in the delivery of construction projects in Western Australia. They have a superb 40 year track record of successfully delivering high quality, safe projects under their ISO9001:2008 Quality accreditation and AS/NZS4801:2001 Safety accreditation.

This Estimator role will involve preparing pricing for a variety of projects involving insitu structures, brickwork and tilt panels, that may be metro based or remote projects in Western Australia. This initial 4 week contract position will therefore appeal to an Estimator seeking diverse project exposure, and increased responsibility and ownership over winning new projects for the business. The prospect of this role moving to a permanent position is extremely high for a candidate who excels in this role.

It is essential that applicants have previously worked as an Estimator for building companies pricing projects valued up to $5m-$10m in Western Australia. Your role will involve reading plans and interpreting specifications to accurately perform detailed take offs and prepare cost plans for new projects. You will also issue tender packages to suppliers and subcontractors.

To be considered for this role ideally you will have:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Construction Management & Economics, Quantity Surveying or Engineering
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as an Estimator for a commercial building company in WA
  • Proven ability to prepare “first principle” estimates on building/civil projects up to $10m
  • Previous success preparing successful tenders for public sector building developments.
  • Excellent computer literacy and ability to use Quest/Expert Estimation software or similar
  • A great attitude to work and a friendly disposition

JobListing.ShortDescription: Front End Web Developer - Brisbane Based - Join one of Australia's fastest growing Tech Companies
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Brisbane Based Position
  • Successful and Growing Tech-Start Up
  • Great Company Culture and Team

Our business Stellar Technology has close ties to the growing and exciting Tech-Start up scene in Brisbane, Australia. There is a real buzz in the city and a lot of investment from both government and corporate in this space. With an increasing shortage of Developers, pay rates increasing, excellent climate and relatively low cost of living compared to other cities, Brisbane offers a great option if you are looking to further your career.

Our client, an award winning and one of Australia’s fastest growing companies is currently looking for a Front End Web Developer to join there high performing team in central Brisbane. The business has a great company culture, is young and dynamic and has a great leadership team.

Key aspects of the role include:

  • Being involved in the technical direction of front end technologies
  • Work with JavaScript frameworks to create scalable applications
  • Testing to ensure stability and reliability of applications
  • Create usable and performance driven UI components
  • Designing tools, such as style guides to ensure other developers can work on the application

To be considered for the role you will need to have the following experience:

  • At least 3 years working with JavaScript
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks and libraries e.g. ReactJS or Angular JS
  • Ideally have experience building responsive web applications
  • Knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3, including pre-processors such as Sass or LESS
  • Can create workflows using tools like NPM and Gulp

This is a great opportunity to get involved with a fast growing and innovate company who have global ambitions and are disrupting the market they are currently operating in.

In addition to the above role we are also looking for talented Front End and Back End WordPress developers and are generally interested in speaking to any IT professionals who might be interested in working in Australia.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below or send me an email directly quoting reference number LE28673

Email: lucas@stellartechnology.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: $90k - $100k + Bonus / Full Private Use Vehicle / Award Winning Contractor / Career Progression into Management Positions / 55 Hours Monday - Friday

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Christchurch - $90,000 - $100,000 + Bonuses + Private Use Company Vehicle
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Well Established & Reputable Christchurch Civil Contractor

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly co-ordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Embrace this exciting career step/Terrific Tier 2 Builder/Professional & Financial Rewards/Outstanding Leadership Team/Multiple Projects in Hand
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Retail/Commercial Developments $10-50m
  • Tier 2 National Builder, Exceptional Reputation
  • Tremendous Package, Outstanding Career Prospects

Our client is a highly successful Tier 2 building company that has a current requirement for a top class, Project Manager to join their Perth team for an upcoming project. This builder has nationwide presence, a young vibrant culture, and a terrific history of successfully completing a broad range of commercial building projects in the $10-50m range. Working within this business is inspiring as the management team is highly professional and promotes in internal culture of innovation and teamwork!

We are seeking a Project Manager on the rise and ready to take the next step in their career. You will have a proven track record of managing commercial building projects valued around $30m for similar sized commercial builders. Your previous experience must include complete Design & Construct retail and commercial building projects of this size from pre-contract stage through procurement, site establishment, construction, fit-out and handover. 

Our client is interviewing currently so you must be available immediately or on a maximum of one month’s notice, to be considered for this superb permanent vacancy. This will be a tremendous long term career opportunity for a Project Manager seeking employment with a highly reputable and successful Tier 2 builder. This business has achieved significant growth in WA in the last few years despite the extremely competitive nature of the current tender market, which is indicative of a great leadership team and uinique construction methodologies. 

You will need the following qualifications, skills and experience to be considered for this tremendous position:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Project Management, Construction Management & Economics, Engineering or similar
  • 5-10 years’ recent experience as a Project Manager delivering various types of commercial building projects in Australia
  • Previous Design & Construct commercial/retail building experience for building companies valued CIRCA $30m
  • Stable work history that includes reputable Tier 1&2 commercial building contractors
  • High level programming skills in MS Project and commercially astute to manage costs and meet budget targets
  • Great interpersonal skills to manage client interaction and ability to lead a team
  • Strong existing network of subbies and contacts in the Perth metro region
  • Currently based in Perth or WA with existing rights to live and work in Australia

A terrific remuneration package of CIRCA $160-180K will be offered to attract the industry’s best Project Manager. Join this terrific company and look forward to outstanding career opportunities as they continue their expansion in WA.

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
An opportunity has arisen for an experienced and energetic Industrial Electrician to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG groups. With business booming, we are looking for someone who shows commitment to the job and will go above and beyond to get things done.

You are able to work in a sole charge capacity, you have impeccable time management skills and you are committed to safety. You are required to have a firm understanding of electrical equipment, as well as proven experience in electrical maintenance in production environments. You are a strong self-starter, open to change and adjust well to new environments. You want to continue to develop yourself professionally and you will have:

  • A current EWRB Registration

  • Solid working knowledge of SCADA, VSD and PLC

  • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

  • Are open to change and adjust well to unique environments

This role will have you working as part of a maintenance team, playing a key part in the maintenance and repair of electrical equipment in a variety of manufacturing and processing environments. This group invests in its people and an attractive pay packet will be offered for the right person.

JobListing.JobTitle: Intermediate - Senior Civil Engineer land and site
JobListing.ShortDescription: Intermediate to Senior Civil Engineer for Emerging Auckland Consultancy with focus on sub divisions
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
3 months into 2016 Civil Engineers stick or twist?
Somehow we have blinked and we are now 3 months into 2016, the year has started quickly and in all accounts is looking to be exciting, busy and very prosperous, or is it? Incidentally what is the view like in your office? If you’re reading this at work I can only assume it’s pretty bleak.
Stellar have been busy forging and strengthening relationships and really delving and uncovering the goals or our clients and are very happy to be supporting this emerging client in growing on its existing high performance and healthy work life balance.
With Long established rock solid reputation and growing success built around its existing team, growth is now the word and this company is looking to bring the right staff in to the fold. With openings for intermediate to Senior Engineers, career plans are waiting for the right candidate who feels they want to pursue and develop their career further in to the management field. Every avenue is covered from soft skill training to freedom to express yourself. If you have an eye on the future there can only be one course of action, get in touch today.

What you will need
• 5+years design experience
• New Zealand Experience
• Strong Sub division experience
• Ability to liaise with clients
• Ambition to grow and develop

What this company will give you
• Great company culture
• Guided career path
• Annual Bonus
• Flexible structured hours
*********************************************************************
I must implore you that New Zealand experience is essential and I cannot consider anyone without recent New Zealand experience.
**********************************************************************
So if you’re tired of flicking through social media every 10 minutes, watching the kettle boil is not making the day run any faster, then I think it is really time to venture out further. At stellar we really believe in partnership and strong relationships and that only comes from listening, and finding out what you want. The best way to see your dreams come true is to voice them, if you match the above criteria then please email adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 09 9691029 and lets change the years forecast together. Your cards may have been dealt but that doesn’t mean this will be your hand for life, the dealer is now looking at you, It’s your turn what will it be? Stick or twist?
 

Adam Towler

JobListing.ShortDescription: International Brands | Market Leading Training
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you passionate about the agricultural industry?
• Do you want a chance to progress your career as a diesel mechanic?
• Are you looking for a change in scenery?
• Do you want to work for a company that rewards their technicians?


A promising role has arisen for a Diesel Mechanic to work for one of the leaders in the Agricultural Equipment industry in New Zealand. In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance, servicing and repair of a wide range of specialised tractors, telehandlers and bailers, as well as a range of axillary agricultural equipment in the workshop and out in the field. You will work for a company that values their staff and encourages progression and career advancement (including international training) from within. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your strong background, solid technical skills and experience and will be rewarded with training opportunities, state of the art work systems, leadership training from strong management teams and a competitive pay packet.

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Proven experience maintaining diesel equipment (preferably with an agricultural background) with trade certification while favourable is not essential.
• Experience working in either a workshop or onsite.
• Excellent diagnostic skills both using computer systems and visually.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Experienced Construction Supervisors step up to Site Management in NZ / Christchurch, Auckland, Queenstown / Hop across the Tasman NOW!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Relocate to New Zealand via Stellar
  • Building Supervisors STEP UP in NZ!
  • Christchurch/Auckland/Queenstown, Start ASAP!

Stellar Recruitment has offices in Christchurch and Auckland in addition to Perth, and through our networks we are sourcing several Commercial Building Site Supervisors who are ready to step up to Site Manager level in the busy New Zealand building sector.

Now is a perfect time to consider moving to New Zealand where there is significant demand for your skills as a commercial building Site Manager. Stellar Recruitment has strong existing relationships with many of the busiest building companies involved in the Christchurch rebuild program, and other significant building projects being undertaken in picturesque locations such as Auckland and Queenstown.

We have multiple roles available for experienced Site Supervisors looking to take the next step in their career and take ownership of running their own building sites as a Site Manager. Ideally you will have a trade background and stable 5-10 years’ experience in Australia or NZ as a Construction/Site Supervisor for reputable Tier 2 or Tier 3 commercial building contractors. You will have exposure planning, coordinating and supervising construction activities on projects $5-50m within commercial, mixed use, education, health, aged care and retail sectors. In addition, you will possess a strong worth ethic, great leadership qualities and excellent communication skills. It is a prerequisite that you have existing rights to live and work in New Zealand and a willingness to relocate there within the next few months.

In New Zealand as Site Manager, you can expect CIRCA $90K-120K depending on location and role specifics. New Zealand is the adventure capital of the world with a fabulous lifestyle and lower cost of living, genuine career opportunities, and long term job security. The time is right to hop across the Tasman and get involved in the busy NZ Building sector!

JobListing.ShortDescription: Structures Foreman
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Structures Foreman

  • Construction of structures for an Health Care facility in Brisbane
  • Fast paced Tier 2 construction company
  • Committed to high performance culture

About the Company:

Our client is a fast paced Tier 2 construction company that have national presence who have an immediate requirement for a Structures Foreman capable in coordinating construction of structures for an Aged Care facility in Brisbane. This is a stable role with a family run company where the owners are still directly involved with the business which leads to quick decision making process and genuine care for their employees.

About the Role:

As a Structures Foreman you will come from a trade background and have at least 5 years’ stable work history supervising structural works on Aged care or Health care projects ideally in Brisbane.
This building business has consistently grown over the last few years and is well respected in the health care, commercial and Defence construction space, so this will be a great step in your career that will help you hone your management skills.

Duties:

  • You will ensure QA and OHS requirements are met
  • Focus on maintaining the project schedule
  • You will be technically capable to interpret drawings and design specs in order to resolve structural challenges on your projects.
  • work in unison with the Site Manager to coordinate subcontractor trades, materials and equipment in order to ensure smooth and efficient running of the site

Skills & Experience:

  • You will be a highly personable Structures Foreman by nature with the ability to lead
  • You will stem from a trade background and have at least 5 years’ stable work
  • You have supervised extensive structural concrete works
  • Technically capable to interpret drawings and design specs in order to resolve structural challenges on your projects.

Culture:

This is a stable role with a company who looks after their employees and are committed to culture.

Benefits:

  • Immediate requirement for a Structures Foreman 
  • subsidised private health care cover
  • Gym available for employee use

JobListing.ShortDescription: • To carry out 3D designs in appropriate software packages for roading andurban development projects
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Daylight savings is here and I suppose “Winter is coming”. AS we adjust to the time change the mornings are sunny and fresh and the working day is an exciting concept, but how long will this last? With the days increasingly getting shorter and your only spare time being the weekend don’t let the change of the seasons become any worse by not being happy at work.

We spend at least 40 hours a week at work, let alone thinking about work in our down time and with the ever increasing digital world the temptation to check our emails on the weekend is constant.


In 2016 life balance and culture are rated as the number one for job seekers, if you’re in any doubt that you’re not working in the right culture you’re lucky, change is no longer a taboo word, and the right opportunity could only be a phone call away.


Stellar have partnered with a top tier consultancy whose values and culture very much match our own. With some great senior acquisitions already, opportunities are available for the right person who wants to join an established company who prides themselves on a family winning culture.


The role:
With the ever increasing demand for work in Wellingtons Transport centre, Stellar are looking to speak with Civil Engineers in the Roading and urban development fields. You will be carrying out *3D designs using *Civil3d, *12d and *Autocad for roading and urban development projects such as geometry and basic pavement design), stormwater and wastewater (catchment flows, pipe sizing, treatment devices) etc. As well as possessing the right technical skill, this role will be client facing, so strong business development skills is essential as you will be attending meetings and building and maintaining relationships etc. Within this role career development is key, and this company is always pushing, and assisting in elevating your career. One final note this role will require travelling to other sites on occasions, so a driver’s licence is required.

What you will need
• Civil Engineering Degree
• 5 years post grad experience
• Storm and wastewater experience
• Proficient in Civil 3D Autocad, and 12D
• Client Facing skills
• New Zealand Experience
• Driver’s license


What we offer you
• Career development
• Established projects
• International consultancy
• Family culture
• Growth
• Senior established team


So if your morning optimism only lasts until your first coffee, perhaps you fell undervalued, or would just to like to hear what’s next, and you match the above criteria, please feel free to drop me a message to adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 099691029, and let’s have a confidential chat about where you want your career to go.


Thank you.
Kind regards,
Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029
E adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
How is the view from the backroom?

After another fascinating and detailed meeting my client is on the lookout for some more fresh faces in the office. With an already established senior team, with a rock solid foundation in the market, and proven guided career paths and plans, growth is at full throttle and the pursuit is on for someone who is not only technically sound, but has the passion for growth and enjoys the work hard play hard culture.

Strong company culture is the foundation to what this company is built on. No matter how much they grow, family culture and values will always stand. In the Auckland hub this company focus on Commercial, High rise, Industrial, retail and senior living, whilst maintaining that work life balance with in house social teams, work nights, picnics, you name it, they do it.

The role is based in Auckland and Stellar are looking for a structural Engineer with 5+ years post grad experience, strong detailed design using either ( ETABS, SPASS GASS or REVIT ) possessing strong client facing skills, and are excited by passion and growth, and have ambition to grow in their career.

What you will need
• Engineering Degree
• 5+ Years detailed design experience (ETABS, SPACE GASS or REVIT)
• Client facing skills & business relationship skills
• CPENG or working towards CPENG

What you will receive
• Established Senior Team to be moulded by and progress
• Family Culture
• Exciting projects
• Career plans
• Guided support

Maintaining a healthy tenure in the modern day can be a struggle, lack of reward and benefit being a huge factor. This company writes the book on support, with career plans in place and management training for the right candidate this really is the company of choice for structural Engineers. Break away from the chains of corporate and enjoy the work hard play hard culture that that is 2016 New Zealand contact adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or drop me a call to 09 9691029 and lets change your view together.

Thank you

Kind regards,

Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029
E adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Stellar Recruitment are looking for ambitious, capable and energetic people with a good dose of common sense to join our team. We work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do.

- Your own reliable transport in order to get yourself to and from site
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
- Able to provide your own hand and power tools

Ideally we are looking for a highly health and safety aware, positive and hardworking attitude. We are prepared to wait for the right person for this role.

JobListing.ShortDescription: •Engaging and supportive team environment •Progression and training opportunities •Top $$ paid for top mechanics
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you a qualified Heavy Diesel Mechanic with strong Truck and/or Equipment exposure?
• Do you have strong visual and computerised diagnostic exposure?
• Are you sick of being treated like just another number?
• Want to learn to ski and snow board in your weekends?


Due to continued growth, some exciting, progressive roles have become available for Truck Mechanics to align with one of the market leading companies operating in New Zealand. You will be responsible the planned and reactive maintenance, servicing and diagnostics of many heavy transport units, working within a rapidly expanding workshop with a team of like-minded technicians. Representing some of the most respected brands within New Zealand and internationally, safety standards second to none and an ever expanding workload, there is no better time to look at making the move.

You will need the following:
• Trade Qualified and at least 3 years’ experience within a heavy transport environment.
• Proven exposure in diagnostic equipment with solid fault finding abilities.
• Exposure to a range of heavy transport brands or a solid background specializing.
• Strong self-starter and a desire to grow and progress career.
• Solid understanding of how to be part of an efficient and “well oiled” team, all working toward a common goal.
• Sole charge or field service experience would be advantageous.
• Ability to relocate to New Zealand


ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR THE RIGHT CANDIDATES

JobListing.ShortDescription: Our client, a rapidly growing mining company has a current requirement for an experienced Shotfirer for one of their contracts in the NSW Coalfields.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Full Time Permanent Position
  • Gunnedah Location
  • Work Monday to Friday

An excellent opportunity currently exists for a knowledgeable and driven Shotfirer to partner with a growing mining house in NSW. As Shotfirer you will be directly responsible for conducting safe blasting operations at all times; achieve and exceed production targets where possible in addition to providing support and guidance to the Assistant Shotfirers on site.

To be considered for this exciting opportunity you must have the below skills:

  • Minimum three years coal mining experience as a Shotfirer
  • Current NSW Blasting License
  • Technical expertise across blasting activities
  • Exposure to the design and marking out of drill plans
  • Devotion to safety requirements as per mine regulations
  • Good communication skills

In return you will be provided with a permanent position within a close-knit team working at one of this expanding mining companies operations. You will be remunerated competitively and will be able to live and work in the same area.

Happy to consider candidates willing to relocate.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Are you an experienced industrial electrician who is ready for a challange and enjoys being part of a great team? Than we want to hear from you!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
We are looking for a forward thinking and experienced Maintenance Electrician with a ‘can do’ attitude to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG companies. With business booming, we are looking for someone who can roll up their sleeves and is ready to get their hands dirty. In this role you play a key role in the maintenance and repair of electrical equipment in a variety of manufacturing and processing environments. You will work in an efficient and timely manner, all the while demonstrating your commitment to safety.

This role will require you to have the ability to work as part of a team, as well as in a sole charge capacity and have impeccable time management skills. You must have a firm understanding of electrical equipment and practices, and you will have the desire to continuously develop yourself while working in an ever changing and fast paced environment.

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Current NZ Electrical Registration

  • Experience in electrical maintenance in fixed plant environments

  • Knowledge ofSCADA, VSD and PLC

  • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

  • A strong self-starter mentality with the ability to work in a team and a sole charge capacity

  • A flexible attitude towards to change and adjust well to unique environments

An attractive pay packet will be offered to the right person who shows commitment to the job, loyalty to the company and goes above and beyond to get the job done.

To apply, or if you would like to know more, please contact our specialist maintenance trade and electrical recruiter today.

Charlotte Heystek

03 353 5687

Charlotte.h@stellarworkforce.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Are you a trade qualified maintenance engineer or fitter? And do you enjoy working in a team environment? Then we want to hear from you!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
We are looking for an experienced and energetic Maintenance Fitter with a ‘can do’ attitude to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG groups. With business booming, we are looking for someone who shows commitment to the job and will go above and beyond to get things done.

In this role you will be part of a maintenance team, playing a key part in the on-going planned maintenance and repair of a wide range of fixed plant (manual and automated) equipment, including servicing, commissioning/decommissioning and shut downs.

You are required to have a firm understanding of engineering practices, as well as proven experience in maintenance in production environments. You are able to work in a sole charge capacity, you have impeccable time management skills and you are committed to safety. You will have the desire to continuously develop yourself, you are a strong self-starter, open to change and adjust well to new environments. You will also have:

  • A relevant trade qualification

  • Strong visual fault finding and computer diagnostic skills

  • Exposure over both manual and automated plant equipment and machinery

  • A good, basic understanding of electrical systems such as PLC’s, VSD’s and SCADA

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

This group invests in its people, values health and safety practices and encourages progression from within, with internal training and prospects. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your background, technical skills and experience, and an attractive pay packet will be offered to the right person.

To apply, or if you would like to know more, please contact our specialist maintenance trade and electrical recruiter today.

 

Charlotte Heystek

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Distinguished Large Commercial Builder
  • Job Security on a Major Perth Project
  • CIRCA $145K Package, START ASAP!

We are seeking an experienced Site Supervisor (Fit Out) to work on a large commercial building fitout project starting ASAP. This is a permanent role with a distinguished large commercial building company, ideal for a Fit Out Supervisor with recent experience planning and executing major fitout programs for head contractors.

This company is a trusted name in the commercial building sector and can offer long term job security for a Fit Out Supervisor at the top of their game. You will join the project to initially help plan the fitout program in conjunction with various stakeholders by attending design meetings, and then supervise and coordinate the various fit-out trades as the project advances. The project site is near central Perth so is easily accessible to those living either North or South of the River.

To be considered as Site Supervisor (Fit Out) you must have:

  • Trade certification as a Carpenter & Joiner
  • 5+ years of experience as a Fit Out Supervisor/Site Manager on major multi-level commercial building fit outs in Perth/Australia for head contractors
  • Fit out experience for head contractors on high-rise apartments, office towers, hotels or mixed-use developments preferred
  • Unwavering commitment to safety and quality
  • Great communication skills to provide input to buildability & design meetings
  • Strong leadership skills manage and coordinate tradestaff during delivery stages
  • Favorable references from past head contractor employers from the last 5 years

As the successful Site Supervisor (Fit Out) you will be offered CIRCA $135K + super and the security of long term employment on a major project with this high class builder. This client is interviewing ASAP so register your interest NOW!

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact Scott Alexander on 08 94222702 quoting reference number SA28830.

About the Company:

Due to increased steady growth over the last year, this very successful PQS firm is looking for a strong Quantity Surveyor of 3 years + experience who is looking for an opportunity to develop in a fun and dynamic environment. This PQS firm has a well-established local brand, and specialises in project solutions from concept to completion. Emphasis is placed on challenging the norm, where promotion of an entrepreneurial culture is valued and rewarded accordingly. This successful organisation leads by example and are unwavering in their push to challenge the status quo.

About the Role:

Within your role as a Quantity Surveyor, you will collaborate closely with a Senior Manager on the initial stages of contract acquisition. Your reporting lines are direct to the Senior Manager, although this role is autonomous in the sense of full ownership over projects. You will have the opportunity to be involved in some of their largest projects across the business.

Responsibilities:

• Drive the successful delivery of medium to large commercial projects
• Manage and build strong, long-term relationships with partners and customers
• Support a number of key projects at once

The ideal candidate will have:

• Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Quantity Surveyor
• New Zealand based experience
• A degree or diploma in Quantity Surveying
• Demonstrated business partnering abilities
• Display a genuine interest in career development and team leadership
• PQS experience advantageous

Culture:

This PQS firm has developed a strong internal culture of team work, collaboration and a sense of ‘family’ among their valued employees. In their words the solution is simple, it's about people, only great people make great teams. They believe the best results are achieved not only by what you do, but by doing them better than everyone else. The organisation fosters an environment of high performers and high achievers that are handpicked and share the same understanding of success, high performance and enjoyment.

If you are looking for long term career prospects, an excellent remuneration package and the opportunity to be an integral team member for the acquisition and involvement of some of New Zealand’s most exciting and challenging projects, please contact Alisha for a confidential discussion.

There is plenty of room for further career development and growth in the future for you.

This position requires you to be based in either Alexandra or Cromwell, only an hour’s drive from Queenstown.

- A qualified carpenter
- Hold, or able to obtain your LBP

- Be down to earth, well presented, and hard working

They have an upcoming requirement for a Design Coordinator to join their D&C project team on a new major Perth infrastructure project.

This will be a terrific opportunity for a candidate seeking long term job security in Perth and involvement on an iconic development within the Perth metro region. If you have experience as a Design Coordinator on major public infrastructure projects (rail/metro systems/roads preferred), this could be a terrific opportunity for you!

As Design Coordinator you will be a critical conduit for the management and flow of the correct design information to project stakeholders in a timely fashion during the design and construction stages. This will include but will not be limited to; managing a team of designers to meet project targets, managing the design-change process and updating design registers, providing design input during the construction phase, liaising with various design consultants and team members to align budget, procurement and supply chain timelines, and create internal design reports.

To be considered for this exciting new role as Design Coordinator you will need to meet the following criteria:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Engineering, Construction or Design
  • 6+ years post graduate experience in Design Coordinator or similar Engineering roles undertaking tasks outlined above on major public infrastructure projects in Australia
  • Recent experience as a Design Coordinator for Tier 1 construction contractors or engineering companies on rail/metro system/road projects (*Previous experience on Perth PTA/MRWA projects will be highly regarded)
  • Great interpersonal skills to effectively manage internal and external stakeholder interactions across all disciplines
  • Strong work ethic, adaptable and the ability to work to tight deadlines in a fast paced environment.
  • Perth based with existing rights to live and work in Australia

As the successful Design Coordinator, you will be rewarded with a terrific salary package (CIRCA $130-135K + super) that will be tailored to your specific level of skills and experience, and long term job security within a large successful construction company.

*All applications will be treated as confidential and EVERY applicant will receive a response from Stellar.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion please contact Scott Alexander quoting reference number SA28855.

JobListing.ShortDescription: If you enjoy working in an ever-changing and fast-paced environment, then this could be your next role!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:

An opportunity has arisen for an experienced and energetic Industrial Electrician to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG groups. With business booming, we are looking for someone who shows commitment to the job and will go above and beyond to get things done.

You are able to work in a sole charge capacity, you have impeccable time management skills and you are committed to safety. You are required to have a firm understanding of electrical equipment, as well as proven experience in electrical maintenance in production environments.   • Solid working knowledge of SCADA, VSD and PLC

  • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

This group invests in its people and an attractive pay packet will be offered to the right person for the job.

To apply, or if you would like to know more, please contact our fixed plant maintenance recruiter today.

The company is owned by the employees, which means everyone is striving for the success of the business

About the role

This client is in a period of expansion and is looking for an ambitious Civil/Structural Engineer to join, what is currently a small team in Brisbane. This is an opportunity to take a key role in the growth of this business unit, with future potential of shares and profit share, the position will involve a combination of civil and bridge engineering.

Skills and Experience

JobListing.ShortDescription: Long term contract working in bridge replacements and culvert works in Regional QLD
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
CONSTRUCTION INSPECTOR

  • Long term contract position
  • Growing Consultancy
  • Muliple opportunities

About the Client

This client is a growing Australian consultancy with a very strong client base within the transport sector.

About the role

We are working on their behalf to find 4 Construction Inspectors, preferably with a background including exposure to rail engineering and/or bridge/culvert projects. The position will monitor contractor performance from a QA and WHS perspective. This roles are initailly for 6 months. The positions are regional and will based around the following locations: Cairns, Townsville, Bundaberg and Toowomba. These roles are not FIFO, so the successful candidates must either be located in the regions or be willing to relocate at own expense.

Duties

Reporting to the Design and Contracts Manager, the main responsibilities of the Construction Inspector include, but are not limited to the following:

• Review Contractors WHS management plan and assess performance against this
• Review and monitor Contractors Environmental plan
• Monitor Contractors progress against construction plan
• Perform inspections of civil engineering contracts
• Maintain site surveillance and arrange audit inspections

Skills and Experience

• 5 years plus experience of Construction Inspection on Rail and/or building projects
• Ideally Trade Qualification
• Preferably experience in the rail industry or in bridge/culvert works
• Ability to work both as part of a team and independently; self-motivated and able to act on own initiative
• Ideally hold RII40712 Cert IV in Civil Construction Supervision and must have White Card
• Must have access to 4X4 for site visits

What's On Offer

This is an excellent opportunity to join a highly respected engineering consultancy, who work on exciting and diverse projects across Australia. They have a great company culture and defined paths for your career advancement.

Click APPLY or contact Andy Steel for a confidential discussion.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Incredible opportunity for a graduate to learn from industry leading experts and develop to a Commercial Project Manager
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Genuine once in a lifetime career opportunity
• Successful Australasian commercial construction company
• Learn and develop from industry leading experts

About the company:

We are seeking a motivated, driven individual who is passionate about the construction industry and wants to pursue a career in project management. This large commercial firm is an established and successful design and construction contractor. They operate in all sectors with specialist expertise in commercial, retail, infrastructure and government buildings. After a long and successful portfolio in Australia, they have set up in New Zealand has taken the market by storm over the last few years with offices in Christchurch and Auckland.

About the role:

In this role you will collaborate closely with a senior organisational member, working across organisational divisions to constructively develop your expertise as a project manager. The cadetship takes you through modules that align with all aspects of commercial construction over a period of 2-3 years (may be shorter depending on the person). This role is very much long-term focused, where you will progress to a position as a Commercial Project Manager running architecturally designed multi-million dollar projects. This is a structured development programme with a genuine career progression focus. Following completion of your cadetship, you will collaborate with Engineering Consultancies, Designers, Earthworks, Sub Trades and internal industry experts to ensure timely delivery of projects.

Responsibilities:

• Shadowing/observing staff
• Conduct administrative duties such as data entry in the construction programme
• All remedial and ad hock tasks as requested
• Completing training modules as required
• Updating client and project duties

The ideal candidate should have/be:

• Completed a construction based tertiary qualification
• Based in Christchurch or easily able to relocate at short notice
• Possess strong communication skills (both verbal and written)
• Display a genuine interest in committing to this outstanding organisation
• Long-term career focused to develop as a Project Manager

If you are passionate about the construction industry, have a construction related tertiary qualification, and have a genuine interest to pursue a career in commercial project management, we want to hear from you.

Culture:

Construction professionals choose to align their career with this organisation because of their people focused culture, developed and led by their experienced executive team who have worked together over several years. The project and division leaders have progressed through their strong internal training systems, much like the opportunity available in this role.

can express your interest by applying today.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Due to growth within this high profile engineering firm, career opportunities have arisen for an experienced Senior Water/Flood Engineer.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Brisbane CBD
  • International Engineering Consultancy
  • Future managerial and technical leadership opportunities

The company
Stellar Recruitment is partnered with an International Engineering firm who are domestic leaders in the civil, water and environment sectors. They possess long-term proven relationships with their clients and have an enviable portfolio of infrastructure projects across Australia and abroad. Providing solutions to the infrastructure, transport, water and environmental sectors, this company promotes internal staff promotion and development, and is widely accepted as an employer of choice within the consultant engineering community.

The job
As a key member of the organisation you will lead a skilled team of professionals drawing on your diversified knowledge and skill base gained through your extensive experience with in this specialised sector. As the Senior Water/Flood Engineer you will lead and deliver project outcomes to a range of high profile clients where you will enhance your reputation and industry profile. The position will incorporate the delivery of existing projects, leading projects, and exploring exciting new opportunities.

Requirements

  • Proven track record of highly developed consultancy and client liaison skills
  • A strong focus on career development and building your industry profile
  • 8 years + experience in delivering major water, flood and/or storm related infrastructure projects
  • Degree qualification in civil or environmental engineering
  • Extensive exposure to water modelling processes (flooding, stormwater, water balance)
  • Thorough knowledge of Queensland regulatory requirements

This position presents a rare opportunity for you to join an established International Engineering Consultancy, where you’ll add a list of iconic projects to your repertoire. You will be rewarded with a competitive market salary and become part of a high-performing leadership unit. If you seek empowerment and autonomy, with the added benefit of diverse project exposure, I urge to apply.
All applicants will be treated in the strictest confidence.

JobListing.ShortDescription: A great career step for an Estimator
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Estimator

  • First Principle Estimating, Projects ($2-50m)
  • Professional Tier 2 Builder, Great Reputation!
  • Brisbane based position

About the Company:

Our client is a professional Tier 2 commercial and industrial building company that operates nationally and has a great reputation in the delivery of small to medium sized projects valued $2-50m. They have a requirement for an Estimator with approximately 5 years’ experience able to price such projects in Brisbane’s commercial and industrial building sector. This company can offer broad exposure to all types of projects as it undertakes construction projects across a range of industry sectors including education, health, aged care, commercial and mixed use developments, health care, local government and retail.

About the Role:

This will be a great career step for an Estimator with 5 years’ experience who is looking to make a move from a similar Tier 2 or Tier 3 building company and establish a long term career within a supportive and rewarding environment. This company is proud of their long term retention of their staff which is reflective of their career development internally and commitment to staff satisfaction and rewards.

 

Duties:

  • You will be involved in the tender process from start to finish
  • tender submission and administering contracts once award is received
  • Great ability to source and analyse quotations and price of works from subcontractors

Skills & Experience:

  • Between 3-7 years’ experience as an Estimator with Tier 2 or Tier 3 commercial building companies in Australia
  • Excellent ability to identify and source true costs using “first principles” estimating techniques
  • Proven experience producing estimates across a diverse range of commercial building projects valued up to $50m
  • You are seeking a long term career move and personal development opportunities

Culture:

Our client is a building company that embraces establishment of long term careers within a supportive and rewarding environment

JobListing.ShortDescription: Residentially Based in New Zealand | Engaging and Supportive Team Environment | Progression and Training Opportunities
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you a qualified Heavy Diesel Mechanic with strong Truck and/or Equipment exposure?
• Do you have strong visual and computerised diagnostic exposure?
• Are you sick of being treated like just another number?
• Want to learn to ski and snow board in your weekends?


Due to continued growth, some exciting, progressive roles have become available for Truck Mechanics to align with one of the market leading companies operating in New Zealand. You will be responsible the planned and reactive maintenance, servicing and diagnostics of many heavy transport units, working within a rapidly expanding workshop with a team of like-minded technicians. Representing some of the most respected brands within New Zealand and internationally, safety standards second to none and an ever expanding workload, there is no better time to look at making the move.

You will need the following:
• Trade Qualified and at least 3 years’ experience within a heavy transport environment.
• Proven exposure in diagnostic equipment with solid fault finding abilities.
• Exposure to a range of heavy transport brands or a solid background specializing.
• Strong self-starter and a desire to grow and progress career.
• Solid understanding of how to be part of an efficient and “well oiled” team, all working toward a common goal.
• Sole charge or field service experience would be advantageous.
• Ability to relocate to New Zealand


ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR THE RIGHT CANDIDATES

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Multi0national company well established in Hong Kong and China
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint2: Stability with a strong pipeline of large and unique projects

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Multi-national company well established in Hong Kong and China
  • Stability with a strong pipeline of large and unique projects
  • Career opportunity to live and work in Hong Kong

The company:
We are currently working with a leading, multi-national landscaping company with a large number of large scale unique projects across Asia and Australia. Our client has key, long standing partnerships with major, internationally recognised companies and projects.

The position:
Our client is now seeking to identify an experienced, detail orientated and passionate concreting professional with expertise in flatwork and ideally decorative concreting. This role will suit a Concrete Foreman or Supervisor who is still passionate about getting hands on, or an experienced Concreter who is looking for an exciting career opportunity.

Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

  • Flatwork
  • Decorative concreting including stencil, colour, patterns etc.
  • Leadership and supervision of your direct crew
  • Planning and preparation
  • Hands on work, as and when required
  • Coordination with design team and associated divisions
  • Ensure effective management of the project to meet profit, safety, program, environmental and quality objectives
  • Ensure compliance with all company policy and systems

To be considered for this position you must have all of the following:

  • At least 6 years experience within concreting
  • At least 3 years experience with flat work
  • Strong preference will be for you to have previous experience and understanding of decorative concreting
  • Proven ability in your field of expertise and a passion to remain hands on while also leading a crew
  • Ability to fully relocate to Hong Kong
  • Proficient in English

Salary Package:
To be successful in this position you will need to be a high caliber applicant and you will be remunerated commensurate with your expertise and the position.

To apply for this position please click the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email you resume quoting reference number MG27586.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Highly Successful Civil Contractor | Permanent opportunity, becoming a key team member | Auckland City
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Responsible for construction contracts, QA,  H&S and assisting with site management
  • Well-established and successful civil contractor based in Auckland City
  • Remuneration guideline of $75,000

About the Company

Our client is one of the best known civil contractors in the Auckland Region. They provide a range of services to the civil construction industry and have carved out a solid reputation for a number of specialist construction methods, winning repeat business year on year.

About the Role

As the QA/Contracts Engineer you will need to have a background in Civil Construction. You will be responsible for a variety of functions, which will include assisting the project managers with site documentation, H&S, working on tenders and contract administration. You will be the link between the site teams and the office. There will be requirement for site visits, photographing assignments and reporting. This role would best suit a Civil Engineer with experience on site and wanting to move into the office.

Duties:

  • Site audits and incident investigation

  • Pre start documentation

  • Monitor and record variations

  • Complete QA info for client

  • Complete monthly claims

  • Assist with producing Quotes

  • Order materials, plant and equipment

  • Organise subcontractors and tip sites

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering (diploma, degree)

  • 10+ years’ experience in construction industry

  • Understanding of site engineering, tender preparation and QA work.

  • Solid communication skills and ability to relate to all levels within a business

Culture:

This business has a culture of developing and upskilling their employees, with heavy involvement from directors all the way down to site level. They provide autonomy at every opportunity, while also training and mentoring to allow careers continue in the right direction. It is a relaxed, informal office feel, far from the corporate world of a Tier One contractor. If you enjoy a good laugh at work and being involved in a successful team then this is the role.

Benefits:

  • Decent remuneration

  • Negotiable start and finish times

  • Involvement at the leadership table

  • Exposure to a broad variety of business functions

Click APPLY or contact Maurice Deevy for a confidential discussion.

Email: maurice@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

  • Lead a small but ever growing team

Culture:

Benefits:

  • Career growth tailored to your goals
  • Competitive salary package to suit your skills and experience

JobListing.ShortDescription: $90,000 - $100,000 / Company Vehicle / Leading Civil Contractor / Professional Development Opportunities
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly co-ordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz
