JobListing.ShortDescription: Christchurch Based - Work for a company with an innovative approach to land development & great career potential!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Innovative, Successful Company

  • Industry Leading Professionals All Around You

  • Above Market Rate Salary & Great Career Progression

Do you want to work at a leading surveying, engineering and planning consultancy

based in Christchurch. Our company has been locally owned and operated since its establishment over 80 years ago and enjoys an excellent reputation for its high level of expertise. Our staff enjoy cutting edge technology and excellent on-the-job training and mentoring. If you want to be part of a multi-disciplinary consultancy with all the teams working closely together then keep reading.
To be successful in this role, you should have:

  • 5-6 years’ experience in civil engineering, specialising in geotechnical engineering

  • 3 years local experience in the post-earthquake environment in Canterbury

  • Can work well both in a team and on your own

  • Formal Planning and Reporting capabilities

  • Basic IT skills – use of spread-sheets, email etc. on tablets or laptops

  • Working towards CPEng or recently chatered.

  • Excellent communication skills, dealing with both staff & clients in a professional manner

In return you will be part of an innovative and high performing team who strive to be at the top of their field.  Our staff come from a range of different cultures and enjoy a dynamic, harmonious, family-friendly work environment. We operate a flexible work practice with a flat, collegial structure with direct

access to all levels in our organisation.  


To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below.


Alternatively if you want a confidential discussion on this role as well as an appraisal of the current market please contact me on the number below quoting reference JJ28959.

Consultant: Jason Jones
Phone: 03 974 2443
Email: jason.j@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly co-ordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Project Manager | Joinery | Sydney's Inner West | Great $$$
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Project Manager

• Joinery Project Manager
• Vibrant Young Working Culture
• $90-120k Base

About the Company:

Based in Sydney, Brisbane and Perth, they have established a multi-skilled commercial fit out company focusing on high quality joinery and building standards across building refurbishment, corporate offices, retail and hospitality, with more than 20 years’ experience. The custom joinery division’s experience covers both one-off designs and complete office fit outs.

About the Role:

Your new role will require you to project manager between 4-5 jobs at any one time ranging in value from around $50k-1m maintaining a focus on their high quality specialised joinery solutions.

Duties:


• Deliver multiple projects on time and budget
• Monitor and control all QHSE
• Lead and mentor a small team

Skills & Experience:

• Previous experience managing multiple projects
• Working knowledge of Job Pack software
• Joinery background highly desirable

Culture:

Young vibrant working culture that puts an emphasis on maintaining a good work life balance whilst making sure the job is delivered on time and on budget.

Benefits:

• Growth and progression to suit your end goal
• Competitive salary package $$$$$
• Ideally located in Sydney’s inner west

How to Apply:

Click APPLY or contact Adam Beilby for a confidential discussion.
Phone Number: 02 8211 0691
Email: adam.b@stellarrecruitment.com.au
Adapt/Seek number: AB28981

JobListing.ShortDescription: Work for a main contractor in a senior position with an impressive portfolio of work and developed systems in place
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Full time role based in Christchurch
Major commercial main contractor
Work closely with Directors/decision makers

This position is with a sophisticated Main Contractor and Construction Management company that is making its mark on the Christchurch commercial construction market. With multiple large scale commercial buildings already completed, and new projects won, you will be able to put your name toward some of Christchurch’s major developments, leading the project alongside a Senior Project Manager.

With projects valued predominantly in the $15 million to $30 million range we are looking for applicants with substantial Commercial Quantity Surveying experience that are driven and hold real excitement for the rebuild. There is potential to lead a small team of Quantity Surveyors on projects, or work in a sole charge model to suit you.

This company has a fast paced, hardworking, and energetic atmosphere where successes are celebrated. Although they are a formidable force in the market, this is a medium sized company in terms of staff numbers, so you will not be lost in the crowd, you will be able to have influence, and you will be able to speak daily with Directors if needed.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Liaison with clients, design consultants, engineers, and council
- Managing the subcontractor tendering process
- Supplier and material negotiations
- Estimation
- Pricing and scheduling of all quantities
- Variations
- Progress payments
- Final account


Successful applicants will need:
- A relevant Qualification
- 5 years, or more, commercial build based experience
- Have worked as a Quantity Surveyor on projects upwards of $12 million
- Preferably have some New Zealand based experience
- Professional presentation and communication
- A down to earth team player attitude

There is an immediate need for this positon, so this role will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate is secured. This position is based in Christchurch and is a long term full time position. Salary is dependent on the individual’s experience, but is paying up to $130,000. You will need to already be based in Christchurch, or relocate easily at your own expense.

If you would like to know more about this positon and company before you apply please contact Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant in the Commercial Construction space, on 03 974 2442 or 027 635 3330. I am most readily available Tuesdays and Thursdays. All conversations and applications are treated as private and confidential until you have agreed to have your details released.

Look forward to viewing your application soon.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Your opportunity to work for a local building contractor in a team environment, with strong leadership, on challenging and varied Architectural high e
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Local building company
Work with a team of Quantity Surveyors
Good level of work flow

We are currently looking for a qualified Quantity Surveyor at intermediate level to work in an exciting position with full Quantity Surveying responsibilities. This is a great opportunity to further your career and experience, working for a local builder with strong developed systems in place. You will be joining a team of established Quantity Surveyors, working closely with in house Project Managers and a full team of builders.

We are looking for down to earth staff that work hard and play fair. You must have pride in your accuracy and have strong verbal and written communication skills. You will be working on a mix of projects from residential repairs and private alterations, to residential rebuilds and private architectural builds.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Working on a number of projects at various stages
- Pricing new work
- Take offs
- Variations
- Contract administration
- Site visits
- Progress payments

To be successful in your application you will need:
- At least 2 years Quantity Surveying experience in New Zealand
- Ideally be currently based in Christchurch
- Hold a relevant Qualification and work experience
- Be looking for long term employment with residency

If this sounds like the opportunity you have been looking for apply without delay. If you would like to know more about this position please contact Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, on 0276353330, or email brooke@stellarrecruitment.co.nz.

We are also currently recruiting for Senior Quantity Surveyors in the residential, commercial, and pre-construction sectors throughout the South Island.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Mid-tier, longstanding, capable contractor with consistent work flow
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
-  Commercial building contractor
-  Office support staff and established systems in place
-  Stable management team and job flow

We are currently looking to employ a qualified Quantity Surveyor with 4 years’ commercial build experience, or more, working on commercial projects $2Million - $15Million+ in value. This is an all-round/sole charge opportunity where you will be working on multiple projects.

This position is a permanent full time opportunity with a stable employer that is well established in the local market. They have a sound portfolio having completed a solid amount of commercial, industrial, school, and retail builds in Christchurch, as well as hospitality and retail fit outs.

This contractor works closely with engineers and architects, and carry’s its own building staff, Project Managers and Construction Managers. You would be reporting into a Senior Quantity Surveyor and the General Manager, who are both based in your office alongside a medium sized team.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Estimation for bids
- Tender management
- Measuring on multiple commercial projects
- Progress payments
- Final account
- Contract administration

You will ideally have:
- A relevant qualification
- Current existing experience working on commercial builds
- New Zealand based experience
- Be looking for long term employment

This company has a good name in the market, and runs a stable and steady ship. This is a solid employer with solid work on. Salary is dependent on experience ranging from $70,000 -$95,000. There is an immediate need so this positon will be filled as soon as a suitable team member secured.

Please contact Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, if you require any further information on this positon on 027 635 3330 or at brooke@stellarrecruitment.co.nz. I am most readily available on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

All applications and conversations are treated as private and confidential and we do not pass your information on until you have agreed to this.

We are also currently recruiting for a number of Senior Commercial Quantity Surveying positons.

JobListing.JobTitle: Commercial Intermediate Quantity Surveyor and Est
JobListing.ShortDescription: If you are an Intermediate level Quantity Surveyor looking for an opportunity to remain in the commercial space, this could be your chance!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
We are currently looking for a Commercial Quantity Surveyor and Estimator with at least 2 years’ experience working on commercial projects $5Million - $30 Million.      
                                    
This position is working for a national commercial construction company with a strong portfolio of works in both the South and North Island. You will be working as part of a Quantity Surveying team on existing projects, and assisting with pricing for new projects. You will be joining a medium sized professional and friendly team, working for a stable organisation.

Project scope include the likes of high end architecturally designed office blocks, apartments, hospitality premises, and larger scale projects $10 million + working alongside Project Management Consultancies. Needless to say this is a very exciting opportunity that will commence late January, with interviews occurring in December.

To be successful in your application you will possibly have the following:
• A relevant qualification
• New Zealand experience
• At least two years’ experience working as a Quantity Surveyor
• Experience working on projects around the $2 million mark, or more
• Be passionate, committed and professional
• Be self-motivated and eager to prove your self

With the opportunity to work and play in Queenstown in a career position, we look forward to viewing your application soon!

Please contact Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, if you require any further information on this positon on 027 635 3330 or at brooke@stellarrecruitment.co.nz. I am most readily available on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

All applications and conversations are treated as private and confidential and we do not pass your information on until you have agreed to this.

JobListing.ShortDescription: If you enjoy working in an ever-changing and fast-paced environment, then this could be your next role!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
An opportunity has arisen for an experienced and energetic Industrial Electrician to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG groups. With business booming, we are looking for someone who shows commitment to the job and will go above and beyond to get things done.

You are able to work in a sole charge capacity, you have impeccable time management skills and you are committed to safety. You are required to have a firm understanding of electrical equipment, as well as proven experience in electrical maintenance in production environments. You are a strong self-starter, open to change and adjust well to new environments. You want to continue to develop yourself professionally and you will have:

  • A current EWRB Registration

  • Solid working knowledge of SCADA, VSD and PLC

  • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

  • Are open to change and adjust well to unique environments

This role will have you working as part of a maintenance team, playing a key part in the maintenance and repair of electrical equipment in a variety of manufacturing and processing environments. This group invests in its people and an attractive pay packet will be offered for the right person.

To apply, or if you would like to know more, please contact our specialist maintenance trade and electrical recruiter today.

 

Charlotte Heystek

03 353 5687

Charlotte.h@stellarworkforce.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Stellar Workforce is seeking experienced haul truck operators. Offering 7/7 roster, BIBO of Mackay & Rockhampton & located in the central Bowen Basin
JobListing.JobFullDescription:

  • 7/7 roster with Camp & Meals provided
  • Immediate Start

The team at Stellar Workforce would like to hear from experienced Coal CAT Truck Operators who hold RII’s for the following machinery:

  • CAT 789, 793, 797

To be considered for this role you must display a strong and stable work background with at least 3 years recent mining experience, in addition to a safety first attitude. Ideal applicants will be available to commence immediately.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Experienced Parts Interpreters required for a growing Ag Dealerships based in Central NSW. Permanent positions on offer with this market leader
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Have you got strong organisational skills with a personality to match?
  • Parts knowledge from working with a range of Ag Equipment or Earthmoving Dealerships?
  • Want to work for a progressive company who will help you achieve your career goals?

Due to strong continued growth, an opportunity has arisen for a Parts Interpreters to work for a progressive Australian based Agriculture dealership with branches nationwide. In this role you will play a key part in the procurement, stock monitoring and counter sales of a wide range of heavy Ag machinery parts, based in a predominant workshop. You will be working with an experienced team of mechanics, sales reps and managers who get the variety in their workload most companies only dream of. This company has industry safety standards and systems that are second to none and you will have the opportunity to continue to develop your skill and knowledge base as well as experience within the market. You will be rewarded with a very competitive remuneration package and the opportunity to progress your career to the next step, assisted by a management team who have all started out on the floor.

You’ll need to have the following:

  • 3-5 years’ experience working in either Agriculture or Earthmoving dealerships
  • A mechanical aptitude
  • Current Forklift License
  • Experience in a customer service environment.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Be a strong self-starter with excellent time management and organisational skills

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best or advance your career by aligning with a strong procurement team within the Agriculture industry, either way this position is an ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals. As an employer, this company has a strong market profile and stability, providing excellent longer term growth potential.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, or for info on other opportunities that we have throughout Australia please hit apply and one of our team will be in touch.

Mark Powell
Email: mark@stellarworkforce.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Highly Successful Civil Contractor | Permanent opportunity, becoming a key team member | Auckland City
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Responsible for construction contracts, QA,  H&S and assisting with site management
  • Well-established and successful civil contractor based in Auckland City
  • Remuneration guideline of $75,000

About the Company

Our client is one of the best known civil contractors in the Auckland Region. They provide a range of services to the civil construction industry and have carved out a solid reputation for a number of specialist construction methods, winning repeat business year on year.

About the Role

As the QA/Contracts Engineer you will need to have a background in Civil Construction. You will be responsible for a variety of functions, which will include assisting the project managers with site documentation, H&S, working on tenders and contract administration. You will be the link between the site teams and the office. There will be requirement for site visits, photographing assignments and reporting. This role would best suit a Civil Engineer with experience on site and wanting to move into the office.

Duties:

  • Site audits and incident investigation

  • Pre start documentation

  • Monitor and record variations

  • Complete QA info for client

  • Complete monthly claims

  • Assist with producing Quotes

  • Order materials, plant and equipment

  • Organise subcontractors and tip sites

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering (diploma, degree)

  • 10+ years’ experience in construction industry

  • Understanding of site engineering, tender preparation and QA work.

  • Solid communication skills and ability to relate to all levels within a business

Culture:

This business has a culture of developing and upskilling their employees, with heavy involvement from directors all the way down to site level. They provide autonomy at every opportunity, while also training and mentoring to allow careers continue in the right direction. It is a relaxed, informal office feel, far from the corporate world of a Tier One contractor. If you enjoy a good laugh at work and being involved in a successful team then this is the role.

Benefits:

  • Decent remuneration

  • Negotiable start and finish times

  • Involvement at the leadership table

  • Exposure to a broad variety of business functions

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Senior Civil Engineer – Land Development

  • Professional Infrastructure Services Firm dedicated to providing client focussed design solutions.

  • Industry Leading Professionals All Around You

  • Above Market Rate Salary & Great Career Progression

Working for a progressive engineering and infrastructure consulting firm and due to expansion and growth we are currently seeking a talented and motivated Senior Civil Engineer to join our dynamic and energetic team based in Christchurch. Within this job you will be providing Civil Engineering consulting services across a diverse range of projects covering stormwater, wastewater, roading infrastructure and land development. You will be undertaking investigations, concept evaluation, detailed design, reporting, drawings and site supervision for multiple projects at any one time. If you want to be part of a multi-disciplinary consultancy with all the teams working closely together then keep reading.
 

To be successful in this role, you should have:

  • Charted (CPEng) degree qualified Civil Engineer experienced in land development

  • Local Christchurch experience in development including client management

  • 3 waters & roading design experience ideally using AutoCAD or 12D

  • Excellent Formal Planning and Reporting capabilities

  • Excellent communication skills, dealing with staff, key stakeholders & regulatory authorities

  • Ability to work across multiple disciplines or projects to meet tight deadlines

JobListing.ShortDescription: Estimator – Civil Construction | Permanent opportunity with reputable contractor | Call Maurice on 099691022
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Busy Auckland-based contractor with great reputation
  • Highly successful team, consistently winning work
  • Decent salary on offer for the right candidate

Our client is a leading contractor providing a range of services to the civil infrastructure industry. They are currently looking for a versatile an enthusiastic Intermediate-level Estimator.. Away from the chaos, this role would suit candidates looking to get out of the CBD traffic and based North of the Bridge. This role will be an office-based position with very limited site-based responsibility.

Overview:

This role requires a candidate with a solid background in civil works, ideally with experience working on Earthworks, Drainage, Structures and Siteworks.

Reporting to the Operations Manager, key responsibilities will include:

  • scheduling/estimating

  • cost management

  • subcontractor management

  • schedule of quantities and applying rates

  • tender preparation and analysis

  • progress claims and assessing variations

  • Liaising closely with Project Managers (monthly progress claims and variation costing)

  • Managing pricing of tender process

Minimum requirements:

  • 5years’ experience estimating on civil construction projects

  • Proven ability to win projects

  • Excellent computer skills, knowledge of Excel and Candy Software is key

  • Having a relevant tertiary qualification and relevant training is highly desirable

  • Experience and an excellent understanding of the local market is essential

Culture

This contractor is well-known for retaining it's employees. They are a lively bunch with a passion for their work, and take no chances in their recruitment process. They will find like-minded individuals who share the passion for the industry, good sense of humour and up for a laugh with the team.

JobListing.JobTitle: Graduate Project Manager Cadetship – Commercial Co
JobListing.ShortDescription: Incredible opportunity for a graduate to learn from industry leading experts and develop to a Commercial Project Manager
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Genuine once in a lifetime career opportunity
• Successful Australasian commercial construction company
• Learn and develop from industry leading experts

About the company:

We are seeking a motivated, driven individual who is passionate about the construction industry and wants to pursue a career in project management. This large commercial firm is an established and successful design and construction contractor. They operate in all sectors with specialist expertise in commercial, retail, infrastructure and government buildings. After a long and successful portfolio in Australia, they have set up in New Zealand has taken the market by storm over the last few years with offices in Christchurch and Auckland.

About the role:

In this role you will collaborate closely with a senior organisational member, working across organisational divisions to constructively develop your expertise as a project manager. The cadetship takes you through modules that align with all aspects of commercial construction over a period of 2-3 years (may be shorter depending on the person). This role is very much long-term focused, where you will progress to a position as a Commercial Project Manager running architecturally designed multi-million dollar projects. This is a structured development programme with a genuine career progression focus. Following completion of your cadetship, you will collaborate with Engineering Consultancies, Designers, Earthworks, Sub Trades and internal industry experts to ensure timely delivery of projects.

Responsibilities:

• Shadowing/observing staff
• Conduct administrative duties such as data entry in the construction programme
• All remedial and ad hock tasks as requested
• Completing training modules as required
• Updating client and project duties

The ideal candidate should have/be:

• Completed a construction based tertiary qualification
• Based in Christchurch or easily able to relocate at short notice
• Possess strong communication skills (both verbal and written)
• Display a genuine interest in committing to this outstanding organisation
• Long-term career focused to develop as a Project Manager

If you are passionate about the construction industry, have a construction related tertiary qualification, and have a genuine interest to pursue a career in commercial project management, we want to hear from you.

Culture:

Construction professionals choose to align their career with this organisation because of their people focused culture, developed and led by their experienced executive team who have worked together over several years. The project and division leaders have progressed through their strong internal training systems, much like the opportunity available in this role.

How to apply:

Please contact Alisha via email or phone for a confidential discussion. Otherwise you
can express your interest by applying today.

Consultant: Alisha Murdoch
Phone: 03 9742445
Email: alisha.m@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
About the Company:

This group home building company are well established and are at the forefront of some of Auckland’s biggest residential subdivisions. They have a number of major subdivisions and Housing NZ projects around Auckland and given their already established team, they expect to win a lot more. This is a national company with franchises all over the country and customers are lining up at the door to experience their service and enjoy their quality of home.

About the Role:

Your role will involve sitting alongside some of the best in the industry and plying your craft as Project Manager. Being an integral part of the management team, you will have excellent decision making skills along with the opportunity for innovation to keep this company at the forefront of the build industry. You will have the ability to think laterally regarding the achievement of production targets and have the ability to manage and negotiate the methodology of new house builds on multi dwelling projects.

Duties:

• Ensuring projects run on schedule and within budget
• Ability to communicate effectively with clients and customers
• Lead by example and set the team culture

Skills & Experience:

• 2+ years of residential project management
• At least 6 years in the residential sector
• Sound commercial acumen with demonstrated experience in delivering profitable projects

Culture:

The company describes its culture as innovative, family friendly and inclusive as well as a steadfast dedication to deliver the very best experience to their customers, clients and staff.

Benefits:

• Great salary on offer plus benefits
• Wide array of projects in the sector
• You’re always going to be busy so you’re always achieving
• Multiple sites, multiple project and multiple opportunities for growth

JobListing.ShortDescription: Grow our East Coast Property, Construction and Engineering Divisions. Enjoy real work life balance and positive company culture.

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Enhance our business and positive, progressive culture

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Business Manager – Property, Construction and Engineering

  • Advance your career with Stellar

  • Lead our professional team

  • Enhance our business and positive, progressive culture

About Stellar:
Being the best isn’t everything, a WILL to is.
Here at Stellar we have a genuine desire to be the best at what we do and a relentless commitment to provide our clients and candidates exceptional service.  This experience reflects our great culture where our likeminded staff are nurtured to reach and exceed their potential.  Our vision is to be the number 1 choice for our customers, job seekers and our staff.
When you join Stellar, you aren’t just joining a small team, we are a global company and we are growing, this is a long term career focused company with unrivalled opportunities.

About the role:
Due to our growth an opportunity has arisen for an experienced Business Manager to join the business to lead and grow our Australian East Coast Construction, Property and Engineering divisions. Reporting to the Australian General Manager, The Property, Construction and Engineering Division Manager will be a key member of the Senior Management Team.

This position is based in our Brisbane office and may involve some domestic travel.

This role is a pivotal career move for someone who is currently leading a team, managing key accounts and maximising company revenue though individual and team billings.

You will be responsible to manage and lead the current team of 6 and develop the existing and new consultants who join your team. As the business manager your will generate revenue by leading the sales strategy through strategic business development, establishing preferred supplier agreements and undertake ongoing key account management activities to maximise customer experience and revenue.

Skills and Experience:

  • Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing strategy to grow your relevant sector consistent to business objectives

  • Established an active role and oversee client account management and business development strategies to increase the companies reach and financial strength

  • The ability to provide ongoing high level training, mentoring and professional development to staff as required

  • Dedication to encourage and motivate your team to engage in continuous learning and empower them to achieve personal and company goals

  • Proven experience in leading a team to achieve company objectives and team billing targets

  • Ability to demonstrate successful personal billings

Culture:

Our market leaders choose to join Stellar because our culture is unrivalled and provides its employees with a supportive, rewarding, flexible and progressive environment.

  • $500 per year wellbeing rebate

  • Additional RDO’s and flexible working practices

  • Office catering and weekly Friday social drinks in the office

  • Clear career path with sponsored study options

  • Become an integral part of the true positive team that we are.

Click APPLY or contact Kiara for a confidential discussion.                 
07 3009 9614 or email Kiara.s@stellarrecruitment.com.au #GoingPlacesWithStellar    #aStellarCareer

JobListing.ShortDescription: Highly Successful Civil Contractor | Permanent opportunity, becoming a key team member | Auckland City
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Responsible for construction contracts, QA,  H&S and assisting with site management
  • Well-established and successful civil contractor based in Auckland City
  • Remuneration guideline of $75,000

About the Company

Our client is one of the best known civil contractors in the Auckland Region. They provide a range of services to the civil construction industry and have carved out a solid reputation for a number of specialist construction methods, winning repeat business year on year.

About the Role

As the QA/Contracts Engineer you will need to have a background in Civil Construction. You will be responsible for a variety of functions, which will include assisting the project managers with site documentation, H&S, working on tenders and contract administration. You will be the link between the site teams and the office. There will be requirement for site visits, photographing assignments and reporting. This role would best suit a Civil Engineer with experience on site and wanting to move into the office.

Duties:

  • Site audits and incident investigation

  • Pre start documentation

  • Monitor and record variations

  • Complete QA info for client

  • Complete monthly claims

  • Assist with producing Quotes

  • Order materials, plant and equipment

  • Organise subcontractors and tip sites

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering (diploma, degree)

  • 10+ years’ experience in construction industry

  • Understanding of site engineering, tender preparation and QA work.

  • Solid communication skills and ability to relate to all levels within a business

Culture:

This business has a culture of developing and upskilling their employees, with heavy involvement from directors all the way down to site level. They provide autonomy at every opportunity, while also training and mentoring to allow careers continue in the right direction. It is a relaxed, informal office feel, far from the corporate world of a Tier One contractor. If you enjoy a good laugh at work and being involved in a successful team then this is the role.

Benefits:

  • Decent remuneration

  • Negotiable start and finish times

  • Involvement at the leadership table

  • Exposure to a broad variety of business functions

JobListing.ShortDescription: Iconic Project | Great $$$ | Career Progression | Ideal Location
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Senior Project Engineer-Building Construction

• Be a part of Sydney biggest infrastructure projects
• Multi-billion project with tier one contractor
• Great $$$$$

About the Company:

This established tier one contractor has an exceptional reputation in the delivery of transport infrastructure projects across and abroad. They’ve recently secured a multi-billion dollar contract, for a critical piece of infrastructure in Sydney’s booming industry. On the back of this recent award, they are looking to secure the industry’s best talent to be responsible for the delivery of this complex, career defining project.

About the Role:

This Senior Project Engineer position will be involved in overseeing the delivery of maintenance buildings, structures and depots for the project. You will work closely with the Project Manager, while overseeing Project and Site Engineers, and liaising with supervisors to ensure timely construction delivery.

Duties:

• Lead teams off Site and Project engineers
• Liaise closely with all management, site and design teams
• Facilitate the timely delivery of various depots across the span of the project
• Ensure adherence to schedule and budget parameters
• Oversee sub-contractors and interpret technical documents
• Review quality documentation and ensure compliance to standards
• Enforce strong safety principles and drive a positive culture across the project

Skills & Experience:

• Tertiary qualification in Engineering (Civil or Structural)
• Minimum of 6 years post graduate experience in the construction sector
• Previous track record of delivering industrial or similar construction jobs
• Previous experience working with a recognised Australian construction contractor
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to liaise with external stakeholders

People enjoy working with this company not only due to the high profile of the job and the longevity associated with a project this size but also because of the diversity of projects that this company works on outside of this.   • Tier 1 Contractor

Our top tier client is a major force in Australia’s civil construction sector and they currently have a requirement for a Senior Safety Advisor with over 6 years’ experience to join their nationally recognized construction brand. Candidates with this level of experience are sought to complement their existing senior members within a large site safety team.

As Safety Advisor you will be responsible for implementation of the site HSE management plan to drive an injury free safety culture and ensure compliance across the site. You will maintain a strong field based presence to monitor site activities and liaise with the workforce to convey the safety message while maintaining an even mix of field and office based duties. Within this role you will also undertake incident investigations, hazard identification and some reporting.

Ideally we are seeking candidates who have 6+ years recent experience working on civil construction projects involving road, rail and/or tunnels experience.

To fulfill this role you will ideally meet the following criteria:

  • Cert IV in OH&S as a minimum qualification
  • 6+ years’ experience as Safety Advisor on major infrastructure projects in Australia
  • Previous experience on mega projects (in excess of $500mill)
  • Excellent communication skills to liaise at all levels with various stakeholders

This role offers a Sydney base and a highly attractive salary package that includes base salary, super, with potential provisions for vehicle and project allowances.

About the Company:

Our client is a highly regarded Tier 1 multi-disciplinary contractor currently undertaking a major civil infrastructure project in Perth. Their business is synonymous with the planning and construction of some of Australia’s largest civil infrastructure projects nationwide including roads & major freeways, railway systems, tunnels and dams.

Company Culture:

JobListing.ShortDescription: COmplex projects, dynamic and highly successful team | Great culture.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Busy North Island-based contractor with significant reputation in the NZ market

  • Highly successful team, taking on the most interesting and challenging projects

  • Great package on offer if you can bring the skills … and the attitude.

Our client is a leading contractor providing a range of services to a great number of clients across the North Island. Due to a growing number of projects, they are now considering applications for a Civil Engineer to join them as a Project Manager. You will be joining a high-performing and project-delivering contractor. They reward their staff well with an attactive remuneration package, as well as the opportunity to add value at senior management level. Although the occasional Saturday is involved, management are most eager for the lights to be switched off on a Friday afternoon.

Overview:

This role requires a candidate with an extensive background in civil construction, with particular experience in Heavy Industrial projects where significant problem-solving and planning is required. They are ideally looking for a degree-qualified candidate with close to 10years' experience, someone with plenty of hands-on site knowledge and plenty of exposure to the paperwork and design/planning aspects of project management. They’re looking for a go-getting thinker, someone wanting to take the next step and gain further responsibility. You will be given a great deal of autonomy in this role so a motivated self-starter will do well.

Reporting to the Operations Manager, key responsibilities will include:

  • Project Management, Project Delivery.

  • Ensuring compliance with quality, environmental, company policies and procedures.

  • Contract administration (financials included); coordinating and the delivery of contracts

  • Pricing of projects and ensuring delivery to the highest standards

  • Supervision of sub-contractors and customer relationship management

Minimum requirements:

  • 10years’ Project engineering/management experience in civil construction, ideally within the NZ market

  • Degree qualified in Civil Engineering and with relevant training

  • Proven ability to deliver on large variety of projects (value of c. $1m-$10m)

  • Experience in design work is desirable

  • Excellent computer literacy and reporting skills

Long established, proven PQS firm based in Christchurch

 

  • Career opportunity

  • Intermediate level position

  • Work with a professional and experienced team

This well regarded and time tested professional quantity surveying consultancy is currently looking for an addition to their team offering an exceptional and exciting opportunity for you to progress in your career, hone your skills, and align yourself with a very successful firm and long term employer.

Working at an intermediate level you will work within a team of Quantity Surveyors and report into a Senior QS. You will be working in your own area of projects with a high level of job ownership.   • Liaison with clients, design consultants and construction contractors

Christchurch based experience is preferred but not essential, and ideally you will already be based in Christchurch, or able to relocate there independently. This position will give you the opportunity to work alongside expert Quantity Surveyors forming relationships and making connections with key clients.

If you feel a need to regain some forward momentum in your Quantity Surveying career, then joining a consultancy environment to further your competency is a great career move for those who genuinely want to excel in their profession.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Lead role on greenfield LNG Project. Dynamic Owner’s Team. Full project involvement, from pre-FEED to Operations
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
LNG Project Director

  • Lead role on greenfield LNG Project
  • Dynamic Owner’s Team
  • Full project involvement, from pre-FEED to Operations

About the Company:
A leading diversified resources organisation with over 50,000 employees. The organisation is structured to ensure a flat hierarchy, direct access to the board and quick, dynamic decisions. It is renowned for developing, building, owning and operating projects throughout the energy supply chain.


About the Role:
Steer the project through all project phases and ultimately to a successful completion; ensure the safe and on-time completion of the LNG Plant and associated facilities.


Duties:

  • Manage and coordinator progress of deliverables through all phases
  • Lead and ensure the performance of the technical team
  • Establish project plans and schedules that underpin deliverables
  • Manage and implement safe work systems
  • Liaise and coordinate with the EPC contractor
  • Commission and Start up the Plant
  • Manage hand over to operations

Skills & Experience:

  • Degree-qualified Engineer
  • End-to-end management of at least one LNG plant from pre-FEED to Operations
  • Proven experience of leading projects $1Bn+
  • A ‘doer’ mentality, able embrace change and proactively deal with challenges
  • Values and selects skills and knowledge required to balance teams
  • Geographically mobile; the position is initially based in SE Asia. It will relocate at FEED award and at construction
  • Flexible to facilitate meetings/conference calls across global time zones.

Culture:
People enjoy working for this company for the involvement in this landmark Mega project. Structure is flat and internal decisions are quick.
 

Benefits:
Attractive remuneration package
 

How to Apply:
Click APPLY to register your interest.

Recruitment Resourcer – Stellar Building & Construction

• Opportunity to start your #aStellarCareer
• Learn, Develop and Grow with the industries best
• Contribute to the positive, fun and progressive culture

About Stellar:
Being the best isn’t everything, a WILL to is.
Here at Stellar we have a genuine desire to be the best at what we do and a relentless commitment to provide our clients and candidates exceptional service. This experience reflects our great culture where our likeminded staff are nurtured to reach and exceed their potential. Our vision is to be the number 1 choice for our customers, job seekers and our staff.

About the role:
Due to continued success and internal promotions, this pivotal and highly rewarding position is now immediately available for a Resourcer to join our Brisbane team to support our expanding and experienced Building and Construction Team.

Duties:
• Source, screen, interview and reference check the industries best candidates
• Collaborate with the principal consultant to grow our candidate database
• Build your professional network within the building and construction sector
• Take charge of recruitment drives and database coding
Skills and Experience:
• Confidence communicating via phone and email with a strong attention to detail
• Previous experience within an administration or customer service focused role
• Have the drive to succeed and develop your career
• Be focused and strive to achieve KPI’s

Culture:
Our market leaders choose to join Stellar because our culture is unrivalled and provides its employees with a supportive, rewarding, flexible and progressive environment.
• $500 per year wellbeing rebate
• Additional RDO’s and flexible working practices
• Office catering and weekly Friday social drinks in the office
• Clear career path with sponsored study options
• Become an integral part of the true positive team that we are.


A resourcing role with Stellar is the blueprint to your recruitment career

07 3009 9614 or email Kiara.s@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Long established, proven PQS firm based in Christchurch
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Genuine Career Progression
• Renowned Company in Commercial and Government Projects
• Rewarding Remuneration Package + Bonus

About the Company:

Due to increased steady growth over the last year, this very successful PQS firm is looking for a strong Quantity Surveyor of 3 years + experience who is looking for an opportunity to develop in a fun and dynamic environment. This PQS firm has a well-established local brand, and specialises in project solutions from concept to completion. Emphasis is placed on challenging the norm, where promotion of an entrepreneurial culture is valued and rewarded accordingly. This successful organisation leads by example and are unwavering in their push to challenge the status quo.

About the Role:

Within your role as a Quantity Surveyor, you will collaborate closely with a Senior Manager on the initial stages of contract acquisition. Your reporting lines are direct to the Senior Manager, although this role is autonomous in the sense of full ownership over projects. You will have the opportunity to be involved in some of their largest projects across the business.

Responsibilities:

• Drive the successful delivery of medium to large commercial projects
• Manage and build strong, long-term relationships with partners and customers
• Support a number of key projects at once

The ideal candidate will have:

• Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Quantity Surveyor
• New Zealand based experience
• A degree or diploma in Quantity Surveying
• Demonstrated business partnering abilities
• Display a genuine interest in career development and team leadership
• PQS experience advantageous

Culture:

This PQS firm has developed a strong internal culture of team work, collaboration and a sense of ‘family’ among their valued employees. In their words the solution is simple, it's about people, only great people make great teams. They believe the best results are achieved not only by what you do, but by doing them better than everyone else. The organisation fosters an environment of high performers and high achievers that are handpicked and share the same understanding of success, high performance and enjoyment.

How to Apply:

If you are looking for long term career prospects, an excellent remuneration package and the opportunity to be an integral team member for the acquisition and involvement of some of New Zealand’s most exciting and challenging projects, please contact Alisha for a confidential discussion.

• Reputable international engineering consultancy
  • An exceptional design team backed by a commendable reputation
  • Strong portfolio of projects in multiple industries
  • Desirable Sydney location

Stellar Recruitment is seeking a talented Civil Designer for a dynamic Engineering Consultancy who continue to develop primarily in the Land Development and Urban Development sectors.

To be successful in this role, you must have the following attributes:

  • Strong experience in the Land and Urban Development and industry (3-10yrs)
  • Experience primarily using 12D, AutoCAD, desirably PC-Drain
  • Knowledge of Australian design standards and applicable legislation
  • Ability to structure time and manage workload across internal divisions
  • Ability to communicate at all levels including client liaison

In return for your experience, you will receive:

  • Culture that thrives on passion, innovation and career development
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Proactive mentor environment with a career development path (industry leading program)
  • A strong order book of work ensuring long-term retention
  • Integral member of a high performance team

If you are passionate about civil design, aspiring to make a difference and want to be an integral part of a leading corporate consultancy, I urge you to apply by hitting the link below.

Please note that experience in the Australian consulting environment is essential!

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please email your resume quoting reference number RF28311

Consultant: Rachael Fitzgerald
Email: rachael.f@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Asset Manager – Roads and Highways, 5+ year project, based in Waikato, global company with family values - Call Adam 09 969 1024
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Leading infrastructure and services powerhouse with a global footprint
  • Family friendly culture that promotes work / life balance
  • Take ownership of your career with a clear development plan
  • Salary circa $120,000 p.a. plus vehicle

About the Company:
Stellar Recruitment has partnered with a multi-disciplined infrastructure and services company with an enviable track record of delivering projects across the globe with particular expertise in transport construction, infrastructure services, airports and industrial construction. Although they have 74,000 employees worldwide and a presence in 15 countries across the globe, they still maintain family values and promote a work life balance across their entire operation.

About the role:
This opportunity is for someone who is highly motivated to deliver quality road maintenance projects for the communities of the Waikato region to ensure the safety and efficiency of the network. We are looking for someone to take ownership of their ‘network’, their team and who has experience in State Highway Asset management and a focus on planning and strategy. Based in Hamilton or Paeroa, you won’t have to move to Auckland and experience the increased cost of living.

Duties:

  • Develop and deliver the Forward Works Programme
  • Report directly to National Asset Manager
  • Manage the Asset Engineers and broader team
  • Liaise with the public through effective communication

Skills & Experience:

  • 5 years’ experience State Highway Asset management
  • Experience in NZTA Capital / Maintenance Annual Funding Plan processes
  • Asset management knowledge including NZS 3910 : 2013 and CCA
  • Steadfast commitment to Health & Safety
  • Effective communication skills and customer service experience

Culture:
Although they have a global footprint, their New Zealand team is a close knit family with an adherence to getting everyone home safely after putting in a hard day’s work. They believe in family values and ensuring a healthy work / life balance. They also believe in offering their employees careers, not just a job and as such, provide clear career development plans.

Benefits:

  • Attractive $120,000 salary plus vehicle
  • Stable employment – project is 5+ years
  • Become an integral member of the community
  • Clearly defined career development plan
  • Family culture that promotes work / life balance
  • Based in Hamilton or Paeroa

How to Apply:
Click APPLY or contact Adam Gibson for a confidential discussion
Phone: +64 9 969 1024
Email: adam.g@stellarrecruitment.co.nz
Reference: AG29125

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
International Top Tier consultancy
• Innovative and passionate team
• Above market salary

About the Company:
An International top tier consultancy, comprising of offices New Zealand wide, that brings a wealth of overseas and local experience in making this consultancy the leaders in infrastructure covering transport, water, environmental, resources and much more.

About the Role:
With their solid foundation and reputation bolstered by some senior acquisitions and continued success in winning work this consultancy is looking for a Senior Bridge Engineer for their Auckland branch to cover all aspects of Bridge design from Bid to project delivery.

Our Client is well established Pilbara based Iron Ore producer, with a long-term life of mine. They have several expansion projects that will ensure stable and ongoing employment.

You will be responsible for the maintenance and repair of large mining equipment. This will include break downs and planned maintenance to ensure the equipment is sustaining a high level of availability.

  • Current HR Licence

  • West Australian Mining Experience (Essential)

  • Experience working with large excavators or shovels (300t minimum)
  • Strong technical ability and a good attitude
  • 5+ years’ maintenance experience in WA mining

Culture:

  • An attractive hourly rate

JobListing.ShortDescription: Incredible opportunity for someone to work with a successful locally owned and operated foundations expert
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Rewarding projects
• Successful locally owned and operated construction company
• Excellent remuneration package + phone + laptop

About the company:

We are seeking a driven senior Site Forman or Project Manager to join this successful construction company in Christchurch. This organisation will provide you with a solid foundation of support from an experienced, qualified and knowledgeable team. This organisation specialises in residential and light commercial foundations. Being locally owned and operated, this company has developed a great working culture that is humble, hardworking and professional.

About the role:

This career opportunity would provide you with exposure to liaise direct to clients, stakeholders and consultancies, running large projects start to finish. Full autonomy in this role is given with the right person granted control to oversee quality, time and budget aspects of project management. Some on the tool work will be required on occasion. Having concrete/ foundation experience would be advantageous.

Ideally you will have experience in:

• Organisation of staff and contractors
• Running multiple sites
• Effective communication with geo tech’s and council to ensure correct site preparation
• Solid understanding of foundations standards and practice adherences
• Senior site supervision experience
• Produced projects to a very high level
• New Zealand construction experience

About you:

You are an experienced Project Manager or senior Site Forman who is driven, motivated and only accepts the highest of standards in your work. You are effectively able to manage a diverse range of challenges and timelines with the support of a good team. In return for this, you will be rewarded with aligning you career to a successful construction company with opportunity to be allocated new projects that are currently in the works. This is a genuine opportunity for long-term career progression where you can utilise your experience in commercial build project management.

If you are looking for long term career prospects and the opportunity to be an integral team member for a well-established organisation. Please contact Alisha via email or phone. Otherwise you can express your interest by applying today.

Consultant: Alisha Murdoch

JobListing.ShortDescription: Residentially Based in New Zealand | Engaging and Supportive Team Environments | Learn to Ski and Snowboard in you weekends!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you a qualified Heavy Diesel Mechanic with strong Truck and/or Equipment exposure?
• Do you have strong visual and computerised diagnostic exposure?
• Are you sick of being treated like just another number?
• Want to learn to ski and snow board in your weekends?


Due to continued growth, some exciting, progressive roles have become available for Truck Mechanics to align with one of the market leading companies operating in New Zealand. You will be responsible the planned and reactive maintenance, servicing and diagnostics of many heavy transport units, working within a rapidly expanding workshop with a team of like-minded technicians. Representing some of the most respected brands within New Zealand and internationally, safety standards second to none and an ever expanding workload, there is no better time to look at making the move.

You will need the following:
• Trade Qualified and at least 3 years’ experience within a heavy transport environment.
• Proven exposure in diagnostic equipment with solid fault finding abilities.
• Exposure to a range of heavy transport brands or a solid background specializing.
• Strong self-starter and a desire to grow and progress career.
• Solid understanding of how to be part of an efficient and “well oiled” team, all working toward a common goal.
• Sole charge or field service experience would be advantageous.
• Ability to relocate to New Zealand


ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR THE RIGHT CANDIDATES


To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as shift/roster patterns, location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the gear you could be working on, or for info on the opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Involvement on a broad range of project types
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint2: An appealing remuneration package + super will be offered to the ideal Contract Administrator

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Contract Administrator

  • Great opportunity has become available for a career driven Contract Administrator
  • Involvement on a broad range of project types
  • An appealing remuneration package + super will be offered to the ideal Contract Administrator

About the Company:

Our client is a highly successful team that has had a great opportunity become available for a career driven Contract Administrator to join their fast paced Brisbane or Gold coast teams. This builder has strong national presence, a young vibrant culture, and a terrific history of successfully completing a broad range project types such as: Mid and High rise residential, commercial, retail, aged care and defence.

About the Role:

As Contract Administrator within this business you will work within a successful and vibrant team environment and undertake commercial and cost management duties for projects of various nature within the building space. As a guide your projects will likely include residential, aged care, health care, defence, industrial, office buildings and mixed use developments. This company prides itself on hiring people to develop a long term career rather than gathering a new team per project.

Duties:

  • Within your role you will review tender documentation
  • Prepare subcontractor documents and manage subcontractor packages
  • Manage payments, variations and progress claims, prepare financial cost forecasts, monitor cash flow, budgeting, and prepare progress reports.

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Quantity Surveying or Construction Management & Economics
  • 3-5 years stable experience as a Contract Administrator for commercial builders
  • Proficient using construction specific software
  • Great interpersonal skills, team oriented approach and good work ethic
  • Currently based in Brisbane or the Gold Coast with existing rights to live and work in Australia

Culture:

Our client strives to maintain a successful and vibrant team environment at all times.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Terrific Senior role with a Top Tier Builder in Perth / Major Project Tenders $50m+ / Defence, Hotel project focus / CIRCA $200K Package / ASAP!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Initial 6 Month Contract Role, Perm Options
  • Perth CBD Based, Top Tier Building Company
  • Terrific Rate On Offer, IMMED START Avail!!

About the Company:

Our client is a highly regarded national building company renowned for the construction of major commercial developments $50m+. They have a proud history and track record of executing project scopes within; health, education, commercial, high-rise, retail & shopping centres, defence, aged care and government sectors.   

About the Role:

As Senior Estimator you will be employed on contract basis in Perth initially for a period of six months with a view to permanency pending your success in winning new work. You will lead the pricing and pursuit of new major project tenders typically $50M+ which are likely to be new looming hotel developments and defence work in the next six months.  

Skills, Experience & Other Requirements:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Engineering, Quantity Surveying or similar preferred
  • Minimum 10 years’ experience in Australia for Tier 1 or 2 commercial building companies estimating/cost planning on large major projects ($50M-$100M+)
  • Previous experience using CostX and Buildsoft programs
  • Previous experience estimating and successfully winning hotel and defence related project tenders preferred
  • Excellent all-round communication skills and ability to attend client meetings and deliver presentations at these meetings
  • Self-motivated nature and ability to work unsupervised
  • Currently based in Perth with existing rights to live and work in Australia

Company Culture:

Working within this highly professional company is rewarding and fulfilling. Employees enjoy the benefits of a highly experienced management team, a terrific team environment and outstanding opportunities to work on major commercial building projects in Australia.

Benefits:

  • Job security for the rest of 2016, possibly permanency if you excel
  • Enhance your career with a commercial building icon
  • CIRCA $180K + super (*equivalent dependent on experience)

JobListing.ShortDescription: If you are ready to step into a long-term role in a challenging environment, then this could be your next move!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Become part of a tight-knit maintenance team

  • Long-term career training and development, and stability

  • Challenging role and fast-paced environment

An opportunity has arisen for an experienced and energetic Industrial Electrician to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG groups. With business booming, we are looking for someone who shows commitment to the job and will go above and beyond to get things done.

You are able to work in a sole charge capacity, you have impeccable time management skills and you are committed to safety. You are required to have a firm understanding of electrical equipment, as well as proven experience in electrical maintenance in production environments. You are a strong self-starter, open to change and adjust well to new environments.

This role will have you working as part of a maintenance team, playing a key part in the maintenance and repair of electrical equipment in a variety of manufacturing and processing environments. You want to continue to develop yourself professionally and you will have:

  • A current EWRB Registration

  • Solid working knowledge of SCADA, VSD and PLC

  • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

  • Are open attitude to change and unique environments

This group invests in its people and an attractive pay packet will be offered to the right person for the job.

To apply, or if you would like to know more, please contact our fixed plant maintenance recruiter today.

They have a number of major subdivisions and Housing NZ projects around Auckland and given their already established team, they expect to win a lot more. This is a national company with franchises all over the country and customers are lining up at the door to experience their service and enjoy their quality of home.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Project Architect or Registered Architect role for a firm renowned for the finest designs in the market - Call Jolene Marks (09) 9691023
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• High end unique designs
  • Exquisite architecture with no detail spared
  • Countless awards for fine design and architecture 

About the Company

Renowned for exquisite design that is second to none. This company produces bespoke design on a global standard buildings with no two being the same. Innovation and creativuty is paramount to maintain the creative integrity of the business.

About the Role:

This is a senior role which will see you being supported by a team of design orientated Technicians and Architectural Graduates. The role encompases all phases of the design process and reports to company Director. 

Duties:

  • Run high end projects from the initial client contact through to construction
  • High level of client liaison and contractor coordination
  • Deliver projects on time and within budget
  • Inspire a team to think innovatively and express a design flare 

Skills and experience:

  • Exceptional experience in a similar role
  • Experience working on high end projects
  • Experience liaising with high net-worth clients
  • Highly innovative and a strong design flare
  • Exceptional presentation and communication skills
  • Outstanding client relationship management 

Culture:

Highly collaborative where all ideas and input are valued regardless of level or seniority within the business. Creativity and innovation is actively encouraged and the practice works hard to foster this within the business.

Benefits:

  • Excellent remuneration package
  • Opportunity to work on exquisite designs
  • Internationally recognised company
  • An environment that fosters innovation and creativity
  • High level support from experienced teams

JobListing.ShortDescription: Stellar Workforce is seeking experienced haul truck operators. Offering 7/7 roster, BIBO of Mackay & Rockhampton & located in the central Bowen Basin
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• BIBO Mackay & Rockhampton
  • 7/7 roster with Camp & Meals provided
  • Immediate Start

The team at Stellar Workforce would like to hear from experienced Coal CAT Truck Operators who hold RII’s for the following machinery:

JobListing.ShortDescription: Graduate Transport planner for international consultancy in Wellington
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Career Progression
• International Consultancy
• Above market Earnings

About the Company:

My client is an international consultancy entrenched in the infrastructure sector across transportation, roading, water and waste water. They are powerfully positioned with sites across all major and minor centres in New Zealand and whose potential is unlimited, steadily making them the consultancy of choice in New Zealand.

About the Role:
You will be working alongside senior planners in developing transit routes across wellington. This role is for someone who is Tertiary qualified in Engineering, and is proficient with data sources and good communication skills with both team members and Clients.

Duties:

• Data Analysis and data collection,
• Traffic and transport modelling, management and design
• Working towards and completing all deadlines

Skills & Experience:

• Degree in Engineering or equivalent
• Excellent written and communication skills


Culture:
Award winning culture of excellence where working and succeeding together as a team is the paramount to success. When it comes to hiring this company very much look for the right person who can enrich the already thriven culture with passion for work and life.

Benefits:

• Clear and precise career progression
• An existing thriving team of excellence to learn and be moulded by
• Exposure to exciting projects

JobListing.ShortDescription: Permanent position for a skilled Estimator to be based 10 minutes from Brisbane CBD

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Estimator to join a successful team
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint2: National company active in all sectors
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Rewarded with an attractive salary package

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Estimator

  • Estimator to join a successful team
  • National company active in all sectors
  • Rewarded with an attractive salary package

About the Company:

This multi-award winning national commercial construction company are seeking an Estimator to join their property services division. This team primarily deal with government funded projects such as school, health care and public building upgrades, the projects valuing up to $2mill.

About the Role:

The Estimator will be responsible for growing the business by assisting the team to deliver timely and accurate bids on projects in the south east Queensland area. This fast pace, rewarding role will report into the Senior Estimator and will be critical in the preparation of cost estimates and plans to continue the business’s previous success.

Duties:

  • Measure and compile subcontractor quotes
  • Analysis and negotiation of prices and rates
  • Prepare and present coded Bill of Quantities for internal review
  • Liaise with key stakeholders

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in Building or Construction Management
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience working for a tier 3, tier 2 or a large subcontractor
  • Analytical and logical thinker
  • Good oral and written communication skills

Culture:

This is the opportunity to join a real team environment where everyone thrives on that satisfying feeling of winning a tender. You will be rewarded and nurtured as an asset to the company which has an impressive average tenure across their employees.

Benefits:

  • Varied work and repeat business
  • Focussed career development
  • National long standing business which offers a stable working environment.

How to Apply:

Click APPLY or contact Heather Mamwell for a confidential discussion.

Phone Number:  07 3009 9643

Email: heather.m@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Qualified Estimator for fantastic Tier 1 builder with immediate start available
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Estimator

  • You will be involved in commercial, residential and government projects ranging in value from $5 - 40million
  • Competitive salary package
  • Tier 1 client, Immediate Start available!

About the Company:

Our client is a highly respected, long standing Tier 1 building company. They have an immediate requirement for an Estimator capable of pricing a broad range of future projects that across various sectors.

About the Role:

As Estimator within this reputable building company, you’ll be based in Brisbane or on the Gold coast and focus on compiling estimates for projects within the $5-40m range. You will take responsibility for sourcing subcontractor pricing for strategically targeted tenders for a variety of project types in the Brisbane through to Gold coast regions.

Duties:

  • Documenting and facilitating sub-contractor and supplier tender documents and distribution lists
  • Sourcing and analysis of quotations and pricing of works from subcontractors
  • Coding of all estimates in line with company’s budget breakdown schedules
  • Compilation of tender submissions
  • Responding to client queries post tender submission

Skills & Experience:

  • Ideally you will be an Estimator with over 3 years' experience in Australia’s construction sector
  • You have been working for recognized Tier 1 or Tier 2 building contractor
  • Experience with commercial or apartment building tenders is an advantage

Culture:

You will be offered a terrific remuneration package based on your skills, technical competence and previous industry experience. Apply ASAP to join this stable, reputable builder and enjoy a future career that will expose you to a diverse range of projects with a great Tier 1 company.

Benefits:

  • Terrific remuneration package
  • A well-known stable, reputable builder
  • Enjoy a future career that will expose you to a diverse range of projects in Brisbane.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Strong Family Operated Civil Group | Ready to step off the tools and know how a well oiled workshop is organised? | Have a look at this
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Have you got strong organisational skills with a personality to match?
• Heavy Diesel experience working with a range of heavy equipment in the civil industry?
• Ready to step back off the tools a bit but not have to manage people?


Due to strong continued growth, an opportunity has arisen for a Workshop Coordinator to work for a progressive New Zealand Civil company well known in the in the Auckland and Waikato region. In this role you will play a key part in the organisation, stock monitoring and general reporting, scheduling and maintenance of a wide range of heavy machinery and construction equipment, based in a predominant workshop on the Shore. You will be working with an experienced team of mechanics, and workshop manager who get the variety in their workload most companies only dream of. This company has industry safety standards and systems that are second to none and you will have the opportunity to continue to develop your skill and knowledge base as well as experience within the market. You will be rewarded with a very competitive hourly rate and the opportunity to progress your career to the next step by coming off the tools predominantly, but still being able to get your hands dirty, as you will be an avid team member in this strong clique who is always ready to help your team out.

You’ll need to have the following:
• 2-5 years’ experience in the heavy diesel industry in a hands on roll in the workshop/field.
• Trade Cert/ Pre Trade and a strong understanding of the mechanics of HD equipment/trucks.
• Experienced with computer systems, understand word, excel and office and methodical.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Be a strong self-starter with excellent time management and organisational skills

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best or advance your career by aligning with a strong procurement team within the heavy equipment industry, either way this position is an ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals. As an employer, this company has a strong market profile and stability, providing excellent longer term growth potential.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, or for info on other opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.

Emily Keene
Division Manager – Maintenance NZ
03 353 5684
emily@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Commercial Senior Site Manager

Upon joining this New Zealand owned company you will be fully inducted and supported in your move. Part of this company’s culture is to be open to innovative and new ways of doing things and having a positive work environment with workmates that enjoy being there.
