JobListing.ShortDescription: Carpenter for North Shore and Silverdale location, great hourly rates, Long term projects
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Carpenter

• Key position on site- progression opportunities
• Busy main contractor with many key projects
• Attractive hourly rates

About the Company:

Stellar Recruitment are currently partnered with a market leading construction company, one of the biggest in New Zealand, who is looking for an experienced and motivated carpenter to assist with some of their biggest projects. This main contractor is currently working on some intricate and exciting projects on the North Shore of Auckland and due to the large amount of work, are looking for a qualified carpenter who can get stuck in and get the job done.

About the Role:

You will be working on a large commercial and residential site where you will be involved in all aspects of the building process. You will be required to assist the leading hand carpenter where required and ensure everything runs smoothly on site. Health and safety will be a big focus for you and you will uphold this to the highest standard while on site.

Duties:

• All aspects of carpentry on site as required
• Upholding health and safety requirements to the highest standard
• Assisting the Leading hand carpenter when required
• Complete all work with accuracy and to tight time restrictions

Skills & Experience:

• Trade Qualified carpenter(Certificate 4 in carpentry as a minimum)
• Working at heights trained ( Unit standard 23229 or 15757)
• Ramset license
• Hilti license
• Dogman Certificate
• EWP trained
• At least 2 years’ experience

Culture:

Our client provides a supportive and safe work environment for all employees. They take pride in their team and provide training and progression opportunities to all employees. Although a large team they are personable and inclusive, the site managers know all their guys by name and enjoy a good laugh throughout the day.

Benefits:

• Progression opportunities
• Supportive friendly work environment
• Completive hourly rates

Click APPLY or contact Gabrielle (Gabbie) Findlay for a confidential discussion.

Carpenter- Residential

  • Large residential project- continued work
  • Busy main contractor
  • Attractive hourly rates- Well above market for the right person

About the Company:

Stellar recruitment pride ourselves on our long standing relationships with our business partners and clients. We are currently partnered with a great New Zealand company who believes in providing the best service for their clients. They believe the only way to do this is through the hiring of the right staff members and creating great teams who love where they work and what they do. They have a nationwide presence that provides them with the ability to undertake projects throughout much of New Zealand, while still offering the benefits of a One Team approach.

This is a large residential project where you will be required to work on site Monday- Friday and be involved in all aspects of the building process. You will uphold all health and safety regulations and be prepared to enforce these processes and regulations at all times. This project involves building multi-million dollar houses and has the potential to help you to upskill due to the intricate and interesting nature of these houses.

  • Trade Qualified carpenter(Certificate 4 in carpentry as a minimum)

Our client provides a supportive and safe work environment for all employees. They believe the best way to keep a team of great employees is to make the environment an enjoyable one to work in, offering flexibility, ongoing development and progression plans is one way in which they do this.

  • Respected, NZ owned, stable company
  • In operation for 40 + years

This company is New Zealand owned and has been in operation for over 40 years with offices predominantly situated around the South Island of New Zealand, including Queenstown, Christchurch, and Dunedin. We are actually recruiting for a number of Senior - Intermediate Quantity Surveying openings with this company in each of the locations mentioned above (Christchurch, Queenstown and Dunedin) due to growth.

You will be joining a practised, hardworking, and down to earth culture with low staff turnover, working for a building contractor that is corporate and professional. You will be treated as part of the team in no time and be proud of the company you work for.

Your responsibilities as Senior QS will include:
• Estimation/Bids
• Managing the sub-contractor tender process when jobs are won
• Suppliers price negotiation where required
• Pricing and scheduling of all quantities
• Liaison with design consultants and engineers
• Cost-management
• Variations
• Payment claims
• Final account
• Budget control
• Possible supervision/oversight of staff

This company has completed works in a number of areas over the years such as heavy commercial complexes, apartment blocks, office blocks, commercial fit outs and refurbishment, historical rebuilds, and much more.

We seek a proven Quantity Surveyor with a background in commercial construction or light commercial construction who is adaptable, professional, and motivated. You will need to have at least 5 years of commercial based Quantity Surveying experience, doing the listed tasks above, and hold relevant Qualification. You will enjoy working in a team environment, as part of a team.

These positons will be filled as soon a suitable candidate/s is sourced. If you would like to know more about the company or locations please contact Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, on 027 635 3330 or at brooke@stellarrecruitment.co.nz. I am most readily available on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

All applications and conversations are treated as private and confidential and we do not pass your information on until you have agreed to this.

JobListing.JobTitle: Leading Hand | Workshop Foreman Truck Technician
JobListing.ShortDescription: Are a Qualified Truck Mechanic ready to take the next stpe in your career? | Iveco, Isuzu or Kenworth Trained? | Want Stable, Progressive, $ ?
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• SOLID | STABLE |PROGRESSIVE | VARIETY | FUN
• Kenworth, Isuzu and Iveco Technicians Wanted
• Strong Companies with a culture all about their people.
• NZ Based positions available with a huge emphasis on progression and development.

Due to strong continued growth, a promising opportunity has arisen for Leading Hand Truck Technicians to work for a top companies, operating throughout New Zealand. In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance and repair of a wide range of heavy truck and trailer units and buses in a workshop capacity with a field aspect as required. Leading by example with your already proven experience on the tools you will work with fleets that utilises some of the best technology available in the market, industry safety standards that are second to none and a wealth of knowledge in their leadership teams for you to continue to glean knowledge from but also bring your own experience to. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your technical skills and experience, and will be rewarded with progression opportunities and one of the strongest pay packages in the market along with national and international training, brand specific diagnostics exposure and the opportunity to learn from and teach some of the best that New Zealand has to offer.

You’ll need to have the following:
• Trade Certification with experience within the New Zealand or International market.
• At least 3 years experience as a truck technician or in a heavy transport environment.
• Heavy Transport licences would be highly considered
• Desire to progress your career through working with an advanced fleet and state of the art technology and lead by example.
• Excellent computer diagnostic skills and passion for providing a quality service.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR SUITABLE CANDIDATES

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best and progress your career, or perhaps you’re looking to work for a company that values their employees and has a great company culture - either way, this position is an ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals. As an employer this company has a strong market profile and stability, providing excellent longer term growth potential.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the brands you’ll be working on, or for info on other opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.

Working for a progressive engineering and infrastructure consulting firm and due to expansion and growth we are currently seeking a talented and motivated Senior Civil Engineer to join our dynamic and team based in Christchurch. • Are you a qualified Heavy Diesel Mechanic with strong Truck and/or Equipment exposure?
• Do you have strong visual and computerised diagnostic exposure?
• Are you sick of being treated like just another number?
• Want to learn to ski and snow board in your weekends?


Due to continued growth, some exciting, progressive roles have become available for Truck Mechanics to align with one of the market leading companies operating in New Zealand. You will be responsible the planned and reactive maintenance, servicing and diagnostics of many heavy transport units, working within a rapidly expanding workshop with a team of like-minded technicians. Representing some of the most respected brands within New Zealand and internationally, safety standards second to none and an ever expanding workload, there is no better time to look at making the move.

You will need the following:
• Trade Qualified and at least 3 years’ experience within a heavy transport environment.
• Proven exposure in diagnostic equipment with solid fault finding abilities.
• Exposure to a range of heavy transport brands or a solid background specializing.
• Strong self-starter and a desire to grow and progress career.
• Solid understanding of how to be part of an efficient and “well oiled” team, all working toward a common goal.
• Sole charge or field service experience would be advantageous.
• Ability to relocate to New Zealand


ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR THE RIGHT CANDIDATES


To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as shift/roster patterns, location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the gear you could be working on, or for info on the opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.

Lexi Brady
0011643 974 2441
lexi.b@stellarworkforce.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Top NZ Company | Great Team environment | Training Progression and Immediate start available | Make your mark on the industry....
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you a Mechanical Engineer/ Fitter looking to get off the tools with solid planning skills?
• Do you want a chance to work for a stable and long standing company in the NZ market with room to grow and progress your career?
• Want to work in genuine environment that will provide variety & supportive management?

A promising role has arisen for a proven Maintenance Planner to work for one of the leaders in the processing industry here in Otago. In this roles you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance planning of heavy plant equipment including mechanical and fabrication work and life cycle servicing/refurbishment of components, strip downs and refits across mechanical and electrical facets of the plant. You will work for a company that values their staff and encourages progression from within its small but dedicated team while encouraging you to think outside the box. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your strong background, solid technical skills and experience and will be rewarded with progression opportunities, sole charge responsibilities and a competitive salary package (with a warm office to boot).

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Proven experience Mechanical Engineering (on fixed plant facets) with trade certification and exposure across planning packages.
• Experience working in either a workshop or onsite team as well as independently.
• Excellent diagnostic skills visually and fault finding capabilities (this will help you be the expert in the planning team)
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• A strong ability to be a self-starter and get the job done.
• A fantastic attitude and a good amount of job pride.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the gear you could be working on, or for info on the opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.

Emily Keene
Division Manager – Maintenance and Building NZ
03 353 5684
emily@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Unique opportunity to join a great national business going from strength to strength
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Quantity Surveyor

 

Our client has a current need for a Commercial Quantity Surveyor working in a leading in NZ building business who has an attractive opportunity available within their established operation. With a large portfolio of existing work, a pipeline of new projects coming on line through a loyal and established client network, and an enviable reputation of delivering key projects throughout the region, they are exceptionally well positioned within the local and regional market.

 

Your responsibilities will include:

  • The successful delivery of new building projects

  • Managing a number of projects at the same time

  • Building strong relationships with partners and customers

  • Provide project support for key projects

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Quantity Surveyor

  • Experience with the repairs and rebuilds in Christchurch will be an advantage

  • A Degree or Diploma in Quantity Surveying or related engineering discipline

  • Will be confident and effective at communicating to senior management, consultants, sub-contractors and clients

  • An excellent stakeholder engagement skills

  • Excellent Excel skills

     

    You will take an active role assisting in the tendering process, developing and maintaining relationships with existing and new clients, sub-contractors and other specialists, and your knowledge of the industry will lead to overall success within this fun and dynamic team.

     

    In return, in addition to an industry leading salary package, you will be surrounded by professional and motivated colleagues across the management, site and office teams, and enjoy the unique opportunity to be involved in key projects in the Canterbury rebuild and development projects throughout the broader South Island. You will be able to pursue professional development, will have a clear career development path, and will be able to establish a position as a respected professional in one of the country’s most successful construction firms.

     

Please contact Matt to have any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this position. Otherwise you can express your interest by applying today. Your application will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

 

Consultant: Matt McIntyre
Email: matt.m@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Planner required to assist with major projects on a local and national level

• Prominent Construction Contractor

JobListing.ShortDescription: Senior Contract Administrator/ Junior Project Manager with a thorough understanding of Fit- out projects, Fantastic opportunity for career growth.

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Permanent requirement working between corporate office and site
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint2: Our client is an outstanding top tier 2 building company

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Senior Contracts Administrator

  • Permanent requirement working between corporate office and site
  • Our client is an outstanding top tier 2 building company
  • Fantastic opportunity for career growth

About the Company:

Our client is a top tier 2 building company with exceptional processes and procedures that has an immediate requirement for a top class Senior Contract Administrator/ Junior Project Manager to join their Brisbane team for a newly secured project. This builder has nationwide presence and a long standing footprint in Queensland with strong client relationships, leading to repeat business.

About the Role:

As Senior Contract Administrator/ Junior Project Manager within this business you will work within a team environment and focus. You will be involved in a great fit-out project with value in excess of $30 million. You will be a “self-sufficient” Senior Contract Administrator/ Junior Project Manager with a thorough understanding of Fit- out projects and someone who possess a great attention to detail. You will have a tertiary qualification in construction management, a driven attitude and a desire for career progression towards Project Management, this would be highly regarded and supported by our client.

Duties:

  • Within your role you will manage subcontractor packages
  • You will also be responsible for payments, variations and progress claims, prepare financial cost forecasts, monitor cash flow, budgeting, and prepare progress reports
  • Ability to manage Contract Administrators and other project team members where required
  • Monitor works to identify and immediately act upon any risks or opportunities.
  • Identify scope gaps between trade packages and ensure that all works are included in a trade package

Skills & Experience:

  • Degree or Diploma in Construction Management
  • Extensive Contract Administration experience and ready to take the next step in the Construction Industry.
  • Proven fit-out experience is essential
  • Reputation and track record of capable and proven performance in achieving targets

Culture:

Our Client strives for ‘Shared Success’. This is achieved by developing high performing teams that are aligned to their vision and values.

Benefits:

  • Not only does this position offer an attractive remuneration package, super and the chance to join their superb company culture, but also the opportunity to establish yourself as a future leader.
  • Long term career prospects within a great building company

How to Apply:

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number KS29234.
Consultant: Kate Szczurowski
Phone: 07 3009 9630
Email: kate.s@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Genuine career development opportunity
• National commercial construction company
• Excellent remuneration package

About the company:

Incredible opportunity in Queenstown to work for a national commercial construction company with regional branches in Auckland, Christchurch, Southern Lakes and Dunedin. They have a reputation for delivering high quality construction projects over a range of different areas from commercial and residential to government and education.

About the role:

In this role you will collaborate closely with a team of Quantity Surveyors You will work on a range of projects assisting with all projects on the commercial building side of the organisation. Ideally you will be based in Queenstown, or be in a position to relocate
independently.

Role responsibilities will include:

• Contract negotiation, scheduling and pricing projects
• Liaising closely with a team of Quantity Surveyors
• Managing the pricing of the tender process
• Detailed pricing and scheduling of quantities
• Contract administration, cost-management, variations, payment claims


To quality for this role you should have:

• A tertiary qualification, degree or equivalent in Quantity Surveying
• Commercial construction experience
• Ability to effectively communicate with a range of people
• Quantity surveying or estimating experience for multi-million dollar projects
• Knowledge of the local market would be an advantage
• 5+ years’ experience in commercial construction

Culture:

Construction professionals choose to align their career with this company because of their reputation for delivering high quality construction projects, on time and to budget. They achieve this by building and maintaining lasting relationships both within the organisation and in the wider New Zealand. Emphasis is placed on collaboration and team work in a fun, dynamic and professional environment.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Terrific Tier 1 Commercial Builder / Major High Rise Development, Perth CBD / Deliver high end detail to finishes / July Start / CIRCA $145K + super
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Perth CBD Location, Top Tier Building Firm
  • Multi-level Commercial Development
  • CIRCA $145K + super, START JULY 2016!!

About the Company:

Our client is a highly regarded national building company renowned for the construction of major commercial developments $50m+. They have a proud history and track record of executing project scopes within; health, education, commercial, high-rise, retail & shopping centres, defence, aged care and government sectors.   

About the Role:

The Fit Out Supervisor will take responsibility for ensuring a high level of detail to finishes delivered by subcontractors, on a major commercial building project in Perth. You will attend and lead meetings with subcontractors and drive their performance. You will work as part of an experienced Fit Out team and report to the Site Manager and Project Manager. You will be required to work on selected rostered weekends, and commence in early July.

Skills, Experience & Other Requirements:

  • Relevant trade qualification as a Carpenter & Joiner or similar
  • Minimum 5-10 years’ Fit Out Supervision experience for head contractors on high rise apartments/hotels/office building developments
  • Major project experience as a Fit Out Supervisor ($80M+) for Tier 1 building companies in Australia will be highly regarded
  • Excellent ability to interpret drawings and specifications for commercial building projects
  • Great communication skills and ability to attend and contribute to client/subcontractor meetings
  • Self-motivated nature and a good team player
  • Currently based in Perth with existing rights to live and work in Australia

Company Culture:

Working within this highly professional company is rewarding and fulfilling. The business exudes a culture of excellence  right from the top down. Employees enjoy the benefits of a highly experienced management team, a terrific team environment and outstanding opportunities to work on major commercial building projects in Australia.

Benefits:

  • Job security with a top tier builder
  • A challenging and rewarding landmark project
  • CIRCA $135-145K + super (*Based on experience)

JobListing.ShortDescription: Work for a main contractor in a senior position with an impressive portfolio of works and developed systems in place, on $20 million + projects
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
- Strong contender in the market
- Major commercial main contractor
- Work closely with Directors

This position is with a sophisticated Main Contractor and Construction Management company that is making its mark on the Christchurch commercial construction market. With multiple large scale commercial buildings already completed, and new projects won, you will be able to put your name toward some of Christchurch’s major developments, leading projects alongside a Senior Project Manager.

With projects valued predominantly in the $15 million to $30 million + range, we are looking for applicants with substantial Commercial Quantity Surveying experience that are driven and hold real excitement for the commercial rebuild. There is potential to lead a small team of Quantity Surveyors on projects, or work in a sole charge model to suit you.

This company has a fast paced, hardworking, and energetic atmosphere where successes are celebrated. Although they are a formidable force in the market this is a medium sized company in terms of staff numbers, so you will not be lost in the crowd, you will be able to have influence, and you will be able to speak daily with Directors if needed.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Liaison with clients, design consultants, engineers, and council
- Managing subcontractor tendering process
- Supplier and Material price negotiations
- Estimation as required
- Pricing and scheduling of all quantities
- Variations
- Progress payments
- Final account

Successful applicants will need:
- A relevant Qualification
- 10 years, or more, commercial build based experience
- Have worked as a Quantity Surveyor on projects upwards of $12 million
- Preferably have some New Zealand based experience
- Professional presentation and communication
- A down to earth team player attitude

There is an immediate need for this positon, so this role will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate is secured. This position is based in Christchurch and is a long term full time position. Salary is dependent on the individuals experience but is paying up to $130,000.

If you would like to obtain more information on this position please contact Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, on 027 635 3330 or at brooke@stellarrecruitment.co.nz. I am most readily available on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Your opportunity to work for a commercial building contractor in a hard working but fun and fair team environment, running commercial sites.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Permanent position
• Run your own site/s
• Professional organisation

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a company that has a clear idea of who they are and what they represent in the market. Based in Christchurch you will be playing your part in the commercail rebuild, working for an organisation with a stable amount of prominent construction on the go, and a pipe line of projects to follow.

This company prides itself on producing quality commercial builds, with staff that are solutions focused, professional, and work cohesively on projects. In this role you will be working closely with a Project Manager and Quantity Surveyor to lead construction from start to finish.

To be successful in this position you will ideally:
• Have a trade certified carpetendry background
• Have at least 8 years’ experience working in commercial construction $10M +
• Have at least 3 years’ experience as a Site Manager in commercial construction
• Have a good understanding of local building codes and a substantial amount of recent New Zealand experience
• Experience managing all contractors and sub-contractors

You will lead by example and have a client focused approach to your work. You will be able to organise your site and have it running to ensure a quality, timely, and safe completion.

This company has roots well embedded in New Zealand and is mature in its approach to company growth – ensuring they do not exceed their optimum amount of staff. So this is an exciting and long term opportunity for the right person.

We are looking to fill this position ASAP, as there are sites waiting for you! Please contact Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, if you require any further information on this positon on 027 635 3330 or at brooke@stellarrecruitment.co.nz. I am most readily available on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

All applications and conversations are treated as private and confidential and we do not pass your information on until you have agreed to this.

JobListing.ShortDescription: CBD Location | Great $$$ | Career Progression | Projects $5-15mill
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Contract Administrator

• Diverse fit out projects ranging from $5-15 million
• Top tier builder
• Salary package tailored to skills and experience

About the Company:

They operate with over 500 employees located in their state offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide, Canberra and Perth. They work across all major property sectors including commercial office, retail, residential, hotels and hospitality to health and aged care. Core areas of operations are Construction and Fitout & Refurbishment and they produce an annual revenue of $1bn.

About the Role:

As Contract Administrator within this business you will work within a successful and vibrant team environment and undertake commercial and cost management duties for projects of various nature in the commercial building an fitout space. As a guide your projects will likely include schools, aged care, health care, defence, industrial, office buildings and mixed use developments. This company prides itself on hiring people to develop a long term career rather than gathering a new team per project.

Duties:

• Review tender documentation
• Prepare subcontractor documents and manage subcontractor packages and payments
• Monitor and prepare variations and progress claims
• Prepare financial costs and forecasts, monitor cash flow and budgets

Skills & Experience:


• Tertiary qualifications in Quantity Surveying, Construction Management & Economics or Engineering
• 3-5 years stable experience as a Contract Administrator for commercial builders of a similar size
• Proficient using relevant construction specific software
• Great interpersonal skills, team oriented approach and good work ethic
• Currently based in Australia with existing rights to live and work

Culture:

Vibrant workplace environment with an ideal Sydney CBD location. They take pride in developing employees careers within the business and promote based on performance.

Benefits:

• Competitive remuneration package to attract the ideal Contract Administrator
• Located in the heart of Sydney’s CBD
• Unlimited career progression

How to Apply:

Click APPLY or contact Adam Beilby for a confidential discussion.

• Diverse fitout projects ranging from $5-15 million
• Top tier builder
• Salary package tailored to skills and experience

They operate with over 500 employees located in their state offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide, Canberra and Perth. They work across all major property sectors including commercial office, retail, residential, hotels and hospitality to health and aged care. Core areas of operations are Construction and Fitout & Refurbishment and they produce an annual revenue of $1bn.

As Foreman you will be required to coordinate all onsite construction activities. As a guide your projects will likely include commercial office, retail and hospitality fitout and refurbishment. Project value will range from $5-15 million. This company prides itself on hiring people to develop a long term career rather than gathering a new team per project.

About the Company:

Stellar Recruitment are currently partnered with a market leading construction company, one of the biggest in New Zealand, who is looking for an experienced and motivated working foreman to assist with some of their biggest projects. This main contractor is currently working on some intricate and exciting projects on the North Shore of Auckland and due to the large amount of work, are looking for a qualified working Foreman who can manage a team to tight deadlines and projects specs.

About the Role:

You will be working on either the large residential or commercial site depending on your area of expertise, where you will be involved in all aspects of the building process. You will be required to lead a group of 20 Carpenters, Builders, Hammerhands and Labourers and ensure everything runs smoothly on site. Health and safety will be a big focus for you and you will uphold this to the highest standard.

• Attend meetings with the site manager and report on your progress
• Take direction from site managers and work together to produce great work
• Complete all work with accuracy and to tight time restrictions

• Working at heights trained ( Unit standard 23229 or 15757, prefered)

Our client provides a supportive and safe work environment for all employees. They take pride in their team and provide training and progression opportunities to all employees. • South Auckland Location.

About the Company:

Stellar recruitment is currently partnered with a market leading supply chain and logistics company who are looking for skilled truck drivers to help deliver their client’s needs. This exclusive role would suit a class 5 truck driver with experience driving truck and trailer or semi-truck and trailer and good knowledge of the supply chain industry and a steadfast approach on efficiency and professionalism.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Experienced leading hand diesel fitter required for a large open cut coal mine near Moranbah. Must have recent & relevant supervisory experience.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• New Pre-strip Project | Moranbah
  • Ongoing Role | Camp Accommodation
  • DIDO 7/7 Roster

Stellar Workforce has an ever increasing workforce within the Bowen Basin. Our maintenance professionals & trades people are highly experienced and our clients can offer long term ongoing work. We have an urgent requirement for a Leading Hand Fitter to supervise a crew of Diesel Fitters and Serviceman at a large open cut project in Moranbah.

The role:
If successful for this position you will be required to carry out repairs, maintenance, and diagnostics on heavy mobile earthmoving equipment. You will also have supervisory experience and will be able to lead a small team providing technical support and advice on faults, along with safety and time management. Full camp accommodation and meals will be provided.

The successful applicant MUST possess the following:

  • Diesel Fitting or Mechanical Trade
  • S1,S2,S3 & G2
  • Experience on heavy earthmoving equipment - preference for CAT and Hitachi.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Current Coal Board Medical
  • Current Standard 11 or BMA Induction
  • At least 12+ months experience as a leading hand or supervisor

In addition to the above, our client will look favourably on candidates who can demonstrate experience working for OEM's and/or Tier One contracting companies.

If you possess the necessary skills you are encouraged to apply by clicking the link below and quoting reference number JE27740.

Phone: (07) 3009 9619

JobListing.ShortDescription: $90,000 - $100,000 / Company Vehicle / Phone / Strong Forward Workload / Excellent Job Security / Career Development Opportunities

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint2: Strong Forward Workload, Excellent Job Security

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly co-ordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Sales Administrator required for a High Performer in a Award winning firm, flexible hours, great remuneration - Call Adam 09 969 1020
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Sales Administrator required for a High Performer
  • Highly regarded and award winning real estate agency
  • Great salary and benefits on offer

About the Company:
Stellar Recruitment has partnered with a well-known and successful Real Estate company to source a Sales Administrator for one of their Top Salespeople. The company is well established in the Manukau area with multiple awards across sales, property management and customer service. They are a fast growing firm that believe in innovation and exceeding their clients expectations.

About the Role:
This role would see you taking ownership for all the salespersons back office and marketing functions from sending out newsletters to designing flyers to property suite database management as well as liaising with her vendors, buyers and lawyers as required. In addition the role would require organising all the agents open home information, listing and pre listing packs as well as management of existing listings.

Duties:

  • Assist the Salesperson with their Prospecting pipeline
  • Preparation of sales and marketing material
  • Diary and contact management
  • Information collation and database integrity
  • Create legal documentation required for real estate sales

Skills & Experience:

  • Knowledge of Residential Tenancies Act 
  • Knowledge of Real Estate Agents ACT (2008)
  • Have excellent and efficient administration skills
  • Have Initiative and the ability to pick up systems quickly
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Culture:
Our clients have an inclusive and high performance environment where their clients come first and they celebrate success as a team. They believe in providing a platform to launch real estate careers and ensure everyone has the opportunity to earn their potential.

Benefits:

  • Flexibility in your role and freedom to organise your day as you wish
  • Competitive remuneration
  • An excellent company culture with career development

JobListing.ShortDescription: Based in Auckland City | Contract Role | Starting Immediately | Call Maurice on 099691022
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Well-established civil infrastructure contractor

  • Established team immediately requiring additional engineering support

  • $30-50p/hour depending on experience

About the Company

Our client is an established civil contractor providing a range of services to the construction industry. They are currently looking for a versatile and experienced Project Engineer to work on infrastructure projects in Auckland. They have made their mark on a number of sizable projects across New Zealand, as well as internationally. Having recently won a number of large infrastructure projects and with others in the pipeline, they are now looking to increase their numbers.

About the Role

Key requirement of this role is to plan, schedule and deliver projects in conjunction with the senior project team.  The ideal candidate will have plenty of experience in the New Zealand market. This role will be based in Auckland, and working initially on contract until further (and longer term) projects are confirmed.

Duties:

  • To develop cost effective engineering solutions for the project

  • Review project documents and raise technical queries related to project contract requirements

  • Ensure all HSE requirements are complied with

  • Provide engineering and technical advice to on-site supervisors and other project staff

  • Assist with planning and scheduling the scope of work for the project

  • Select and manage sub-contractors and suppliers

  • Ensure specifications are met throughout the project

  • Assemble and maintain documents and quality records for the project

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering (NZCE, BE, Diploma)

  • 5years’ experience in Site or Project Engineering roles

  • Experience working on a variety of infrastructure projects, with solid understanding of NZ standards and best practice.

  • First aid qualification/experience is desirable

  • Excellent communication skills

Culture:

The company has a relaxed but motivated hard-working culture. Delivering good projects on time and under budget is key for them, and they enjoy celebrating their successes together. They provide autonomy when they can, and enjoy bringing their staff through the ranks as they prove themselves. Someone with a good sense of humour and a passion for quality will do well in this role.

Click APPLY or contact Maurice Deevy for a confidential discussion.

Phone Number: 099691022

Email: maurice@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

About the Company:

Stellar recruitment pride ourselves on our long standing relationships with our business partners and clients. We are currently partnered with a great New Zealand company who believes in providing the best service for their clients. They believe the only way to do this is through the hiring of the right staff members and creating great teams who love where they work and what they do. This company is well known for the removal and rebuild of houses hear in Auckland and is commended for it originality and creativity in design.

About the Role:

This company specialises in Residential new build and removal, in this position you will be involved in all aspects of the building process. You will uphold all health and safety regulations and be prepared to enforce these processes and regulations at all times. This project involves building multi-million dollar houses and has the potential to help you to upskill due to the intricate and interesting nature of these houses. This would be perfect for a qualified builder LBP who has experience working autonomously on site.

• Manage your time with a get stuck in attitude
• Complete all work with accuracy and to tight time restrictions

Skills & Experience:

• LBP qualified Builder
• Site safe passport ( preferred)
• Full driver’s license
• 4+ years’ experience
• Experience working without supervision on site.

Culture:

Our client provides a supportive and safe work environment for all employees. They take pride in their team and provide training and progression opportunities to all employees. They are personable and inclusive, the site managers know all their team by name and enjoy a good laugh throughout the day. They believe the best way to keep a team of great employees is to make the environment an enjoyable one to work in, offering flexibility, ongoing development and progression plans is one way in which they do this.

• Completive hourly rates

Our client is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in civil infrastructure drainage, land development, commercial site works and roading construction projects in Christchurch and the surrounding areas.
They have recently won several major projects and as a result, they now require a Drainage Foreman / Certified Drainlayer to run a new drainage crew in a recently created position . In this role reporting to the Construction Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 3 - 4 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:
• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with Site Supervisor to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Applicants for this role will ideally have:
• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction, especially water reticulation and wastewater management
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commerical drainage projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop develop their skills
This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a site supervisor or project management level position.

About the Company:

International consultancy, renowned for specialism and excellence in Structural engineering, most notably high rise seismic design based across both the North and South Island in Major and minor centres. The foundation of this consultancy is Innovation and team culture with emphasis on collaboration and team bonding in and outside work. Picture high performance rewarding culture with incentives and team trips monthly and annually.

About the Role:

This is a predominately site focused role but requires an individual who understands the delicacies, philosophies and intricacies of seismic design, as well being able to communicate with main contractors across all technical and non-technical aspects of construction and demonstrate a strong understanding of high rise construction methodologies.
This a management role so the right person will be able manage junior staff members, maintain and further establish client relationships as well as have extensive construction experience in high rise buildings, with thorough understanding all the health and safety regulations and legislation and how it applies to this environment.


Duties:

• Liaise between construction activity and the design process.
• Co-ordinate, monitor and observe the work on site in accordance with drawings and specifications.
• Maintain and further establish client relationships
• Mentor and assist junior staff

Skills & Experience:

• Tertiary qualified in Civil Engineering
• 8 years’ experience working in the construction industry - with strong design office or construction industry experience.
• Working knowledge of NZ building and design legislation and regulations, standards, guidelines and codes.



Culture:
As stated above this consultancy prides itself on innovation and collaboration. This is driven by the bond of high performance and life balance which has attracted many active staff members who work and socialise together.




Benefits:

• Exciting award winning projects
• High performance culture, with monthly and yearly incentives, trips and events
• Growth and progress plan.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Senior Business minded water modellar needed in wellington
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• International exposure with established tier 1 New Zealand status
• Award winning projects nationwide
• Above market salary

About the Company:

International based consultancy with a foothold New Zealand wide, who is quickly becoming the consultancy of choice. This consultancy is driven by passion, innovation and pride to be the best. After several recent senior acquisitions this consultancy is driving more growth and looking for the right people to be part of their award winning company and further establish themselves as the leaders across New Zealand.

About the Role:
Looking for a senior business minded professional who has experience in leading, managing and growing storm water business specifically in hydraulic and hydrological modelling. To be successful in this role you will need to possess strong communication skills combined with strategic thinking that can be utilized for positive outcomes, across client facing, leadership, and project delivery. To best support this role you will need broad knowledge across storm water, and specific knowledge in Hydraulic modelling.

As well as leading and growing the business, you are required to be a true leader across your division and sector, managing bid processes, win and deliver work and take a strong role in coaching and developing junior staff members.

Finally showing a clear understanding of:
Open channel modelling
DHI software (including MIKE FLOOD and MIKE URBAN)
Hydrology software HEC-HMS and Hilltop (preferable)
2D floodplain modelling
Coupled hydraulic modelling
Pipe network modelling
DHI software
ArcGis
Autocad (although optional)
Project management skills
Understanding of surface water hydraulics
Infoworks software (preferable)

All though this role does require a senior position we are also looking for an intermediate modular who can be developed in to this role in the future.

Duties:

• Lead, manage and grow storm water business specifically in Hydraulic modelling
• Manage bid process, win and deliver work
• Develop and mentor Junior staff




Skills & Experience:

• Tertiary degree in Engineering
• Strategic thinking , and leadership skills for positive outcomes
• Mentoring and growing business

Culture:

Award winning culture, driven from the top. This company believe in being the best, and know that having the right people is paramount to this. Picture local and international experienced engineers driven to the same goal of being the best and achieving together. Don’t worry about corporate politics here, it’s all about winning and celebrating together.

Benefits:
• Award winning progression and support scheme
• Work life balance, supported from the top.
• International exposure and resources.

How to Apply:
If you match the above criteria and would like to make the most of your career move, please see the info below and attach your CV to Adam Towler titled with the seek reference number. Thank you and I look forward to hear from you.
